commit_message:
Drop references to git.openstack.org

This updates extraction of governance data to use the new URL paths
under opendev.org.

Change-Id: I95e03e19b001e1ba57c59b4adcbfe9b29d03f9a2
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
WIP: Remove deprecate default domain id compatibility

This cleans up an old TODO in the code. Instead of automatically
placing users and groups in the default domain if a domain_id isn't
specified in the request or if a domain-scoped token isn't user, we
raise an error.

Depends-On: Iae7b7c0ce2227ce8cca0cca4906adc29ae933981
Change-Id: I48ebe3b4ac24d1ec33073c666a38887bddb299a2

commit_message:
Call create_user with a domain

The v3 API states that a domain should be specified when creating
users or groups. If a domain isn't provided in the request, the
identity service will attempt to pull the domain out of the token
provided in the request. This requires a domain-scoped token in order
to do so. This commit makes one of the quota tests supply a domain
with the user being created in the requests.

Change-Id: Iae7b7c0ce2227ce8cca0cca4906adc29ae933981

'}, {'created': '2017-08-10 17:29:18.000000000', 'message': "Remove dependency.provider

to know what API it provided. To do that, it needed to register
an instance of itself in a global registry. The pattern looked
similar to the following:

  @dependency.provider('identity_api')
  class Manager(manager.Manager):
     ...

The decorator then carried out a bunch of logic to build the
actual registry and provide the backends. A common way to solve this
problem without coupling what each API providers to itself is with
the use of meta class.

Metaclasses can be used to perform registration when the objects are
created or when modules are loaded at import time. This changes moves
the dependency logic into a metaclass and removes the need for the

commit_message:
Remove dependency.provider

The @dependency.provider decorator required each subclass of Manager
to know what API it provided. To do that, it needed to register
an instance of itself in a global registry. The pattern looked
similar to the following:

  @dependency.provider('identity_api')
  class Manager(manager.Manager):
     ...

The decorator then carried out a bunch of logic to build the
actual registry and provide the backends. A common way to solve this
problem without making each API aware of what it provides is with
the use of metaclasses.

Metaclasses can be used to perform registration when the objects are
created or when modules are loaded at import time. This changes moves
the dependency logic into a metaclass and removes the need for the
@dependency.provider wrapper.

This is a different approach to something David was working on a
while back:

    I25366ce7e9648eef2b3b97f9ec28a55c2053a8e8

Co-Authored-By: David Stanek <dstanek@dstanek.com>
Change-Id: Ic2c0a52a0e065c7f6397bf7732aa134ed5dc9c70

commit_message:
Adopt openstack/openstack as TC repository

openstack/openstack is a technical repository that contains
references for other changes in openstack official repositories.

To avoid an unnecessary rename, we should adopt it as a TC repo.

Change-Id: I1abbbd71bfde755d6cd4e4fdaccb8a1d44afbfaa

commit_message:
Adopt openstack/arch-wg as TC repo

The openstack/arch-wg was used by the Architecture workgroup,
a TC workgroup that ceased operations a couple of years ago.

To avoid an unnecessary rename, we should adopt it as a TC
repo.

Change-Id: Ibeec53fb1a2841027b921e087c9cdb9ad64a5f2b

commit_message:
Adopt openstack/governance-website as TC repo

The openstack/governance-website drives the top index content
for governance.openstack.org, and is driven by the TC chair.
It's a bit of an oversight that it's not listed yet as a TC repo.

Change-Id: I5673e1b61ce4f622aff910169c1c568b786a8343

commit_message:
Elasticsearch, Fluent-logging, Kibana Ingress Policy

This adds ingress network policy for the fluent-logging, kibana
and Elasticsearch charts. This leverages the helm-toolkit template
that was used in openstack-helm for the openstack services

Change-Id: I2a89b62f1002851346e9a25de40113078e9c518f

subject: WIP: help prometheanfire for crazy postgresql bulk insert
messages:
[{'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-17 20:32:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-17 20:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

He said this didn't help:
2019-04-17 15:35:15.376 6402 ERROR placement sqlalchemy.exc.InvalidRequestError: This Session's transaction has been rolled back due to a previous exception during flush. To begin a new transaction with this Session, first issue Session.rollback(). Original exception was: (psycopg2.IntegrityError) duplicate key value violates unique constraint "traits_pkey"'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-17 21:02:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3:45:32 PM) zzzeek: mriedem: "autoincerment" in postgresql comes from a sequence object that is independent of the table itself
(3:45:42 PM) zzzeek: mriedem: so if the table has rows that were hand-inserted into it using ids that the sequence has not addressed yet, "autoincrement" inserts can fail unless the sequence is bumped manually
(3:45:53 PM) prometheanfire: that's why then
(3:46:15 PM) prometheanfire: since I did the manual table import (didn't see the migrate script for postgres)
(3:46:44 PM) zzzeek: prometheanfire: so you need to find the sequences in quesstion and do ALTER SEQUENCE
(3:46:47 PM) zzzeek: to bump them up
(3:47:47 PM) mriedem: prometheanfire: ah...
(3:47:47 PM) prometheanfire: ok, will after reqs meeting is done
(3:47:54 PM) prometheanfire: mriedem: yep
(3:49:38 PM) mriedem: we should maybe document a known issue in https://docs.openstack.org/placement/latest/upgrade/to-stein.html
(3:49:54 PM) mriedem: in case others miss the pg script - or maybe the pg script is missing something
(3:50:59 PM) prometheanfire: it may be missing something, as it imports the table and does not strip the ID
(3:51:06 PM) prometheanfire: at least when I read it
(3:51:44 PM) mriedem: hmm, we have a grenade postgresql job but i think it's in the experimental queue, maybe that's hitting this in stable/stein as well
(3:52:29 PM) prometheanfire: same might happen in other tables with sequences (user, tec)
(4:00:03 PM) prometheanfire: looks like that fixed it'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-17 21:02:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

TODO: figure out if the grenade-postgresql job is also busted (in stein?).'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-17 21:16:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Testing grenade-postgresql in stein here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/653587/'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-17 21:16:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Story 2005478'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-18 19:16:27.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/653587/ shows things working fine as long as the postgresql-migrate-db.sh script is used.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-04-18 19:16:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I've got a docs patch here: https://review.openstack.org/653833"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-17 20:32:18.000000000', 'message': "WIP: help prometheanfire for crazy postgresql bulk insert

The trait sync is failing with duplicate entries because it
appears the bulk insert on postgresql is trying to re-use
existing primary keys rather than properly auto-increment.

Let's see if the Session.bulk_insert_mappings helps.

https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/session_api.html#sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session.bulk_insert_mappings

Change-Id: Ic31f12a7897b84999c8ea12c717d4cb25ba5556d
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: help prometheanfire for crazy postgresql bulk insert

The trait sync is failing with duplicate entries because it
appears the bulk insert on postgresql is trying to re-use
existing primary keys rather than properly auto-increment.

Let's see if the Session.bulk_insert_mappings helps.

https://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/13/orm/session_api.html#sqlalchemy.orm.session.Session.bulk_insert_mappings

Change-Id: Ic31f12a7897b84999c8ea12c717d4cb25ba5556d

commit_message:
Adding unique constraint for port_id

A port should only be associated to a firewall group. This patch adds
unique constraint for port_id attribute of FirewallGroupPortAssociation
table to avoid duplicate records.

Co-Authored-By: Yushiro FURUKAWA <y.furukawa_2@jp.fujitsu.com>

Change-Id: I59554c165aefd378ad0ab8205f74676dc04b3eea

commit_message:
Fix announce email project names

Argument naming ambiguity led to grabbing the wrong value. This updates
repo name handling to grab from the right input.

Change-Id: I4987fc012a07344cbc4290e33eae5b772270eb07
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2018-11-16 06:51:19.000000000', 'message': "lvm: Avoid premature calls to terminate_connection for muiltiattach vols

Previously the LVM volume driver would always call termiante_connection
on the configured target driver regardless of of the associated volume
being attached to multiple instances on the same host. This isn't an
issue for the tgt target driver used by upstream CI as this call is a
noop but does cause the lioadm driver to prematurely remove specific
host ACLs for volumes that are still being used.

This change introduces a simple check to ensure that the target driver
is only called when a single attachment remains that is in turn using
the connector provided by the caller.

Finally as a result of this bugfix the changes introduced by
I84f607de13bc17b00609ad37121d8678f7f4a920 to disable the multiattach
feature when using the lioadm target driver are removed.

Closes-bug: #1786327
Change-Id: Ib5aa1b7578f7d3200185566ff5f8634dd519d020

commit_message:
lvm: Avoid premature calls to terminate_connection for muiltiattach vols

Previously the LVM volume driver would always call termiante_connection
on the configured target driver regardless of of the associated volume
being attached to multiple instances on the same host. This isn't an
issue for the tgt target driver used by upstream CI as this call is a
noop but does cause the lioadm driver to prematurely remove specific
host ACLs for volumes that are still being used.

This change introduces a simple check to ensure that the target driver
is only called when a single attachment remains that is in turn using
the connector provided by the caller.

Finally as a result of this bugfix the changes introduced by
I84f607de13bc17b00609ad37121d8678f7f4a920 to disable the multiattach
feature when using the lioadm target driver are removed.

Closes-bug: #1786327
Change-Id: Ib5aa1b7578f7d3200185566ff5f8634dd519d020
(cherry picked from commit d0b59152ed413f39599ffd1554c0e4e0038431aa)
(cherry picked from commit 3bec6d69a8ef90b3d3582f73be7968e0adfad23a)

When uploading a volume to glance as an image, the glance server don't know the
image size, so the backend storage server(such as ceph) need to resize the
image every time it received new chunk of data(by default 64KB in most
backends, ceph is 8MB).  So there will be huge times of resize operations that

exact size, and don't need to resize the image again and again in data transfer

commit_message:
Allow image size be set when in 'queued' status

When uploading a volume to glance as an image, the glance server don't know the
image size, so the backend storage server(such as ceph) need to resize the
image every time it received new chunk of data(by default 64KB in most
backends, ceph is 8MB).  So there will be huge times of resize operations that
will impact the performance.

This patch aims to let the client has a chance(only when image status is
'queued') to specify the image size, so that glance can create an image with
exact size, and don't need to resize the image again and again in data transfer
phase.

Implements: blueprint specify-image-size-to-avoid-backend-resize
Closes-Bug: #1792710

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-15 17:14:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix OVN provider for Octavia DevStack sample file(s)

This patch is fixing the sample file we distribute for enabling the OVN
provider for Octavia by:

* Enabling the o-da service, this is needed for the driver status update
to work.

* Disabling the amphora driver by default.

* Since the amphora driver is now disabled, we can set the OCTAVIA_NODE
variable to "api" (by default it's "standalone")

* Remove the $GIT_BASE variable from the .sample file because that's not
set and doesn't work.

This patch also cleans up the duplicated information about octavia in
the normal .sample file and just point it to the octavia one instead.

Change-Id: I6f1e16c7c1f814b1c899e9ad1fe9bdde1af4a0cd
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix OVN provider for Octavia DevStack sample file(s)

This patch is fixing the sample file we distribute for enabling the OVN
provider for Octavia by:

* Enabling the o-da service, this is needed for the driver status update
to work.

* Disabling the amphora driver by default.

* Since the amphora driver is now disabled, we can set the OCTAVIA_NODE
variable to "api" (by default it's "standalone")

* Remove the $GIT_BASE variable from the .sample file because that's not
set and doesn't work.

* Update documentation w.r.t the above changes.

This patch also cleans up the duplicated information about octavia in
the normal .sample file and just point it to the octavia one instead.

Change-Id: I6f1e16c7c1f814b1c899e9ad1fe9bdde1af4a0cd
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Combine two patches to fix gates

1 - Bump version from 2.6.2 to 2.7.7.
This should fix issue blocking all new patches in
openstack-tox-lower-constraints:
> Error: could not determine PostgreSQL version from '10.7'

More info at https://github.com/psycopg/psycopg2/issues/489

2 - All constants should be consumed from neutron_lib

Change-Id: I3801641d44040c83631339318c4bd92e8e9ff520
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 10:48:07.000000000', 'message': "Don't persist zero allocation ratios in ResourceTracker

The ComputeNode object itself has a facade which provides the
actual default values for cpu, disk and ram allocation ratios
when the config option values are left at the default (0.0).

When we initially create a ComputeNode in the ResourceTracker,
the *_allocation_ratio values in the object are going to be
unset, and then _copy_resources, called from _init_compute_node,
will set the values to the config option values, again, defaulted
to 0.0, but the ComputeNode object, after calling create() or
save(), will change those *on the object* to the non-0.0 we
actually know and love (16.0 for cpu, 1.5 for ram, and 1.0 for disk).

During the update_available_resource periodic, we'll again go
through _init_compute_node and _copy_resources in the ResourceTracker
which will set the configured values (default of 0.0) onto the
ComputeNode object, which makes the _resource_change method, called
from _update, return True and trigger a ComputeNode.save() call
from the _update method. At that point we're *persisting* the 0.0
allocation ratios in the database, even though ComputeNode.save
will change them to their non-0.0 default values *on the object*
because of the _from_db_object call at the end of ComputeNode.save.

So even if the ComputeNode object allocation ratio values are the
non-0.0 defaults, we'll *always* update the database on every
periodic even if nothing else changed in inventory.

This change modifies the _copy_resource method to only update the
ComputeNode fields if the configured ratios are not the 0.0 default.

Change-Id: I43a23a3290db0c835fed01b8d6a38962dc61adce
Related-Bug: #1789654
(cherry picked from commit 2588af87c862cfd02d860f6b860381e907b279ff)
(cherry picked from commit 01265b98c4cd2b1377e891a06ce748fc6f8f3425)

commit_message:
Don't persist zero allocation ratios in ResourceTracker

The ComputeNode object itself has a facade which provides the
actual default values for cpu, disk and ram allocation ratios
when the config option values are left at the default (0.0).

When we initially create a ComputeNode in the ResourceTracker,
the *_allocation_ratio values in the object are going to be
unset, and then _copy_resources, called from _init_compute_node,
will set the values to the config option values, again, defaulted
to 0.0, but the ComputeNode object, after calling create() or
save(), will change those *on the object* to the non-0.0 we
actually know and love (16.0 for cpu, 1.5 for ram, and 1.0 for disk).

During the update_available_resource periodic, we'll again go
through _init_compute_node and _copy_resources in the ResourceTracker
which will set the configured values (default of 0.0) onto the
ComputeNode object, which makes the _resource_change method, called
from _update, return True and trigger a ComputeNode.save() call
from the _update method. At that point we're *persisting* the 0.0
allocation ratios in the database, even though ComputeNode.save
will change them to their non-0.0 default values *on the object*
because of the _from_db_object call at the end of ComputeNode.save.

So even if the ComputeNode object allocation ratio values are the
non-0.0 defaults, we'll *always* update the database on every
periodic even if nothing else changed in inventory.

This change modifies the _copy_resource method to only update the
ComputeNode fields if the configured ratios are not the 0.0 default.

Change-Id: I43a23a3290db0c835fed01b8d6a38962dc61adce
Related-Bug: #1789654
(cherry picked from commit 2588af87c862cfd02d860f6b860381e907b279ff)
(cherry picked from commit 01265b98c4cd2b1377e891a06ce748fc6f8f3425)

debian: fix libvirt package name

The package name for libvirt is not the same on Debian and Ubuntu,
this patch fixes it.

Closes-Bug: #1824991

in kuryr-kubernetes project.

Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes

Is the library license compatible?
Yes - BSD License (3 clause)

Is the library already packaged in the distros we
target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
As far as I know, Ubuntu latest includes

Is the function of this library already covered by
other libraries in global-requirements.txt?
No

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related
dev or infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes,
of course) Which?
Yes, kuryr-kubernetes

If the library release is managed by the Openstack release
process does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?
No

Do I need to update anything else?
No

Change-Id: I2c6ace4f2dffa6a3f6d53eb2fdce71efc2883b85
Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@samsung.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add protobuf to global-requirements

This commit adds protobuf into global-requirements
to make it possible to use PodResources service
in kuryr-kubernetes project.

Is the library actively maintained?
Yes - https://github.com/protocolbuffers/protobuf

Is the library good code?
Yes

Is the library python 3 compatible?
Yes

Is the library license compatible?
Yes - BSD License (3 clause)

Is the library already packaged in the distros we
target (Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?
As far as I know, Ubuntu latest includes

Is the function of this library already covered by
other libraries in global-requirements.txt?
No

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related
dev or infrastructure setup? (Answer to this should be Yes,
of course) Which?
Yes, kuryr-kubernetes

If the library release is managed by the Openstack release
process does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?
No

Do I need to update anything else?
No

Change-Id: I2c6ace4f2dffa6a3f6d53eb2fdce71efc2883b85
Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Fix invalid filter passed to list_volumes

display_name is not a valid filter for list_volumes, i.e., for non-admin
users no matter what value we set for display_name filter, all volumes
will be returned. We'd better to use name filter for it works all the
time.
https://github.com/openstack/cinder/blob/master/doc/source/admin/generalized_filters.rst

Change-Id: Ib25f4767b74d4494edfafa211d5884a01c1b6488

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-12 07:07:39.000000000', 'message': "Choose random value for HA routes' vr_id

HA routers are using keepalived and needs to have virtual_router_id
configured. As routers which belongs to same tenant are using same
ha network, those values have to be different for each router.

Before this patch this value was always taken as first available value
from available_vr_ids range.
In some (rare) cases, when more than one router is created in parallel
for same tenant it may happen that those routers would have same vr_id
choosen so keepalived would treat them as single application and only
one router would be ACTIVE on one of L3 agents.

This patch changes this behaviour that now random value from available
vr_ids will be chosen instead of taking first value always.
That should mittigate this rare race condition that it will be (almost)
not noticable for users.

However, proper fix should be probably done as some additional
constraint in database layer. But such solution wouldn't be possible to
backport to stable branches so I decided to propose this easy patch
first.

Conflicts:
    neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py

Change-Id: Idb0ed744e54976dca23593fb2d7317bf77442e65
Related-Bug: #1823314
(cherry picked from commit a8d0f557d504957aeb91f451105cca9eee2d6adb)
(cherry picked from commit ee2ed681c495c4fc5086d761853731b7dc2fd34f)
(cherry picked from commit 72c9a7ef8416f894a85a36c6b5bbf995e48599d1)
"}, {'created': '2019-04-12 16:03:33.000000000', 'message': "Choose random value for HA routes' vr_id

HA routers are using keepalived and needs to have virtual_router_id
configured. As routers which belongs to same tenant are using same
ha network, those values have to be different for each router.

Before this patch this value was always taken as first available value
from available_vr_ids range.
In some (rare) cases, when more than one router is created in parallel
for same tenant it may happen that those routers would have same vr_id
choosen so keepalived would treat them as single application and only
one router would be ACTIVE on one of L3 agents.

This patch changes this behaviour that now random value from available
vr_ids will be chosen instead of taking first value always.
That should mittigate this rare race condition that it will be (almost)
not noticable for users.

However, proper fix should be probably done as some additional
constraint in database layer. But such solution wouldn't be possible to
backport to stable branches so I decided to propose this easy patch
first.

Conflicts:
    neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py

Change-Id: Idb0ed744e54976dca23593fb2d7317bf77442e65
Related-Bug: #1823314
(cherry picked from commit a8d0f557d504957aeb91f451105cca9eee2d6adb)
(cherry picked from commit ee2ed681c495c4fc5086d761853731b7dc2fd34f)
(cherry picked from commit 72c9a7ef8416f894a85a36c6b5bbf995e48599d1)
"}]
commit_message:
Choose random value for HA routes' vr_id

HA routers are using keepalived and needs to have virtual_router_id
configured. As routers which belongs to same tenant are using same
ha network, those values have to be different for each router.

Before this patch this value was always taken as first available value
from available_vr_ids range.
In some (rare) cases, when more than one router is created in parallel
for same tenant it may happen that those routers would have same vr_id
choosen so keepalived would treat them as single application and only
one router would be ACTIVE on one of L3 agents.

This patch changes this behaviour that now random value from available
vr_ids will be chosen instead of taking first value always.
That should mittigate this rare race condition that it will be (almost)
not noticable for users.

However, proper fix should be probably done as some additional
constraint in database layer. But such solution wouldn't be possible to
backport to stable branches so I decided to propose this easy patch
first.

Conflicts:
    neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py

Change-Id: Idb0ed744e54976dca23593fb2d7317bf77442e65
Related-Bug: #1823314
(cherry picked from commit a8d0f557d504957aeb91f451105cca9eee2d6adb)
(cherry picked from commit ee2ed681c495c4fc5086d761853731b7dc2fd34f)
(cherry picked from commit 72c9a7ef8416f894a85a36c6b5bbf995e48599d1)

commit_message:
Remove deprecations and prepare for major release

We have many things that have been deprecated in the client for several
release cycles now. Part of the challenge with removing these kinds of
things is they require a major version bump when releasing the client.
This cleans up several different areas of concern in the client.

Change-Id: Iaf5dde49f416183f8ad71769cf38815a1cd45ca9
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-15 14:07:47.000000000', 'message': 'Add indicators REST API endpoints

Added REST API endpoints for indicator management:

* GET /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators/supported` to list all
  available indicators names for each of the hardware component.
* GET /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators/<component>/<indicator_ident>
  to retrieve all indicators and their states for the hardware component.
* PUT /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators/<component>/<indicator_ident>`
  change state of the desired indicators of the component.

Change-Id: Ibd7def10526876b85a311c6525148fec5eaef100
Story: 2005342
Task: 30291
'}]
commit_message:
Add indicators REST API endpoints

Added REST API endpoints for indicator management:

* GET /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators/supported` to list all
  available indicators names for each of the hardware component.
* GET /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators/<component>/<indicator_ident>
  to retrieve all indicators and their states for the hardware component.
* PUT /v1/nodes/<node_ident>/management/indicators/<component>/<indicator_ident>`
  change state of the desired indicators of the component.

Change-Id: Ibd7def10526876b85a311c6525148fec5eaef100
Story: 2005342
Task: 30291

commit_message:
Added Placement to the liaisons file

Added myself as the Placement liaison to the API-SIG. There was also an
empty duplicate section for Nova in the file, so I removed that.

Change-Id: I6701a06b8b0a70a2fe010cbd340ef5e6bc2520a7

commit_message:
Allow NovaRbdPoolName to be role specific

Currently, TripleO does not support to create Compute roles
using different Ceph pools as Nova Ephemeral backends.
An admin should be allowed to have groups of compute nodes
using different Ceph's Ephemeral pools improving
availability, reliability and performance.

The change is straight forward adding the
role_specific tag to the parameter NovaRbdPoolName.

Closes-Bug: 1821039

Change-Id: I7c1ac7c0d3a987c8c9c1e070ea773875aa684d88
(cherry picked from commit e4901745ebb2e4c613e270c3d9970e09c257a530)
(cherry picked from commit 5b5e4a5f8e0ef365c5b809b647c12738855139c4)

subject: Fix memory hotplug rule
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos Gonalves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 6579, 'name': 'Nir Magnezi', 'email': 'nmagnezi@redhat.com', 'username': 'nmagnezi'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-17 16:39:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix memory hotplug rule

When booting a system having numerous storage devices and many CPUs, the
boot ends up in emergency target instead of default target and many
storage devices are failing in time out.

Affects systemd-219-62 and its minor releases.

This patch is a work-around until an updated systemd package is
released (RHBZ #1666612).

Change-Id: I0f002871100d0e0e38e29dd4e2c6d6bfd20f8c1b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix memory hotplug rule

When booting a system having numerous storage devices and many CPUs, the
boot ends up in emergency target instead of default target and many
storage devices are failing in time out.

Affects systemd-219-62 and its minor releases.

This patch is a work-around until an updated systemd package is
released (RHBZ #1666612).

Change-Id: I0f002871100d0e0e38e29dd4e2c6d6bfd20f8c1b

commit_message:
Fix the verification method before creating and updating the firewall rule

1.Verify the validity of the icmp port when the protocol is configured.
2.When updating the rule, the modified data should be verified.

Change-Id: I4c4b1cc5ff25b67e77669b721df4fdbb7d47515f
Closes-Bug: #1803499
(cherry picked from commit 22aace21eb0669ba62b337688b7d3bc47577a2b1)

[{'created': '2019-04-17 10:54:33.000000000', 'message': "Fix failed to import test module

The wrap @testtools.skipUnless cause the base class
SnapshotAccessReadBase to be the <type 'function'>,
However, it should be <type 'type'>, this cause the
functional test unbale to import the test module.

Closes-bug: #1769633
Change-Id: I98a296d009e64d6afab02a53bd1af878f78c4321
(cherry picked from commit 9dad727aefcbca647181fa88c38ebf4ac2801bd3)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix failed to import test module

The wrap @testtools.skipUnless cause the base class
SnapshotAccessReadBase to be the <type 'function'>,
However, it should be <type 'type'>, this cause the
functional test unbale to import the test module.

Closes-bug: #1769633
Change-Id: I98a296d009e64d6afab02a53bd1af878f78c4321
(cherry picked from commit 9dad727aefcbca647181fa88c38ebf4ac2801bd3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-05 14:33:09.000000000', 'message': "metadata: Don't use nova-net DNS values with neutron

At the moment, the metadata service makes use of the legacy '[DEFAULT]
dhcp_domain' option when providing a hostname to the instance. This is
used by cloud-init and results in unexpected hostnames for instances
using cloud-init.

While it is not currently possible to obtain the correct value from
neutron via os-vif, this should be possible in the future. Until then,
stop using the incorrect value.

Change-Id: I3940ebd1888d8019716e7d4eb6d4a413a37b9b78
Partial-Bug: #1698010
"}, {'created': '2017-07-06 13:04:12.000000000', 'message': "metadata: Don't use nova-net DNS values with neutron

At the moment, the metadata service makes use of the legacy '[DEFAULT]
dhcp_domain' option when providing a hostname to the instance. This is
used by cloud-init and results in unexpected hostnames for instances
using cloud-init.

While it is not currently possible to obtain the correct value from
neutron via os-vif, this should be possible in the future. Until then,
stop using the incorrect value.

Change-Id: I3940ebd1888d8019716e7d4eb6d4a413a37b9b78
Closes-Bug: #1698010
"}, {'created': '2017-07-06 13:12:41.000000000', 'message': "metadata: Don't use nova-net DNS values with neutron

At the moment, the metadata service makes use of the legacy '[DEFAULT]
dhcp_domain' option when providing a hostname to the instance. This is
used by cloud-init and results in unexpected hostnames for instances
using cloud-init.

Instead of doing this, start using the neutron equivalent - 'dns_domain'
- which is now stored as part of the Network model.

This also fixes a long-standing issue whereby setting '[DEFAULT]
dhcp_domain' to 'None' would result in a hostname of '${hostname}None'
instead of '${hostname}'. This only affects nova-network users.

Change-Id: I3940ebd1888d8019716e7d4eb6d4a413a37b9b78
Closes-Bug: #1698010
"}, {'created': '2017-07-06 13:23:34.000000000', 'message': "metadata: Don't use nova-net DNS values with neutron

used by cloud-init and results in unexpected hostnames for instances
using cloud-init.

Instead of doing this, start using the neutron equivalent - 'dns_domain'

Change-Id: I3940ebd1888d8019716e7d4eb6d4a413a37b9b78
Closes-Bug: #1698010
"}, {'created': '2018-06-18 15:07:57.000000000', 'message': "metadata: Add '[metadata] domain_name' option

At the moment, the metadata service makes use of the legacy '[DEFAULT]
dhcp_domain' option when providing a hostname to the instance. This is
used by cloud-init and results in unexpected hostnames for instances
using cloud-init.

Neutron provides similar functionality itself, either using its own
'dns_domain' option or through optional Designate integration. We could
integrate this but (a) this isn't something anyone seems that bother by
and (b) it would be a breaking change for most users, who already have
this configured. Instead, we add a new '[metadata] domain_name' option,
which does exactly what the old 'dhcp_domain' option but is more
explicit about its purpose and doesn't have any funky nova-network ties.

This also fixes a long-standing issue whereby setting '[DEFAULT]
dhcp_domain' to 'None' would result in a hostname of '${hostname}None'
instead of '${hostname}'. This only affects nova-network users.

Change-Id: I3940ebd1888d8019716e7d4eb6d4a413a37b9b78
Closes-Bug: #1698010
"}, {'created': '2018-06-18 15:46:41.000000000', 'message': "conf: Undeprecate the 'dhcp_domain' option

The metadata service makes use of the deprecated '[DEFAULT] dhcp_domain'
option when providing a hostname to the instance. This is used by
cloud-init to configure the hostname in the instance. This use was not
captured when the option was initially deprecated. Rather than forcing
everyone to migrate to a new option, the old one is simply undeprecated
and moved out out 'nova/conf/network.py' to ensure it won't be removed
alongside the other nova-network options.

This also fixes a long-standing issue whereby setting '[DEFAULT]
dhcp_domain' to 'None' would result in a hostname of '${hostname}None'
instead of '${hostname}'. This only affects nova-network users.

Change-Id: I3940ebd1888d8019716e7d4eb6d4a413a37b9b78
Closes-Bug: #1698010
"}, {'created': '2018-10-05 13:34:58.000000000', 'message': "conf: Undeprecate the 'dhcp_domain' option

commit_message:
conf: Undeprecate and move the 'dhcp_domain' option

The metadata service makes use of the deprecated '[DEFAULT] dhcp_domain'
option when providing a hostname to the instance. This is used by
cloud-init to configure the hostname in the instance. This use was not
captured when the option was initially deprecated. This option is now
undeprecated and moved to the '[api]' group to ensure it won't be
removed alongside the other nova-network options.

Change-Id: I3940ebd1888d8019716e7d4eb6d4a413a37b9b78
Closes-Bug: #1698010

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-16 12:34:18.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a lifecycle bug with child objects

In some edge cases, when a request comes in to update a child
resource (member, HM, or l7rule), the API would not always make
sure the parent object (pool or l7policy) was in a mutable status.

This patch fixes this by checking the parent provisioning_status
before allowing a muttable change on a child object.

It also resolves two cases where a parent object status was not being
reset on a reverted flow.

Conflicts:
    octavia/api/v2/controllers/member.py
    octavia/tests/functional/api/v2/test_health_monitor.py
    octavia/tests/functional/api/v2/test_l7rule.py
    octavia/tests/functional/api/v2/test_member.py

Change-Id: I86f76bebce0993215fd34ccd33251ba1e6c325a9
Story: 2005249
Task: 30043
(cherry picked from commit f73fe9c084ab403df1392723f043604881ae365d)
(cherry picked from commit c0e13c2fded3b7c563a61dd0c82ee26fc7ef0b3b)
'}, {'created': '2019-04-16 12:57:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a lifecycle bug with child objects

sure the parent object (pool or l7policy) was in a mutable status.

This patch fixes this by checking the parent provisioning_status
before allowing a muttable change on a child object.

It also resolves two cases where a parent object status was not being
reset on a reverted flow.

commit_message:
Fix a lifecycle bug with child objects

In some edge cases, when a request comes in to update a child
resource (member, HM, or l7rule), the API would not always make
sure the parent object (pool or l7policy) was in a mutable status.

This patch fixes this by checking the parent provisioning_status
before allowing a muttable change on a child object.

It also resolves two cases where a parent object status was not being
reset on a reverted flow.

Conflicts:
    octavia/api/v2/controllers/member.py
    octavia/tests/functional/api/v2/test_health_monitor.py
    octavia/tests/functional/api/v2/test_l7rule.py
    octavia/tests/functional/api/v2/test_member.py

Change-Id: I86f76bebce0993215fd34ccd33251ba1e6c325a9
Story: 2005249
Task: 30043
(cherry picked from commit f73fe9c084ab403df1392723f043604881ae365d)
(cherry picked from commit c0e13c2fded3b7c563a61dd0c82ee26fc7ef0b3b)

commit_message:
Implement global constraints

In the previous repo build process, we had global constraints which
override upper constraints and anything set in the roles. This was
essential for two purposes:

1. To enable us to pin things that were not in upper constraints. eg: pip,
   setuptools, wheel
2. To enable us to pin things which were in upper constraints, but broken.
   This would usually be a temporary measure until upper constraints was
   fixed.

This patch implements a new variable 'venv_build_global_constraints' which
is a list of constraints to be applied globally for all venvs. This list
will be used to produce a file in the venv suffixed with
'-global-constraints.txt' and will be used on the pip command line when
building the wheels and when installing packages.

We also ensure that all constraints are used when both building and
installing pip, setuptools and wheel into the venv.

Change-Id: I9ae3ef19c863b9237a51d2fcd6f4ebce1a9ebad7

commit_message:
Allow replacing service implementation

Some clouds are offering their own incompatible implementation of system 
services. While with add_service we can add new implementation of the 
service, we can not replace system-ones. So let's allow deleting service 
to be able to have a custom service implementation in SDK.

Change-Id: I55ef310d114702e5dc98a237fc1d8d130c09c5e1

commit_message:
Fix the verification method before creating and updating the firewall rule

1.Verify the validity of the icmp port when the protocol is configured.
2.When updating the rule, the modified data should be verified.

Change-Id: I4c4b1cc5ff25b67e77669b721df4fdbb7d47515f
Closes-Bug: #1803499
(cherry picked from commit 22aace21eb0669ba62b337688b7d3bc47577a2b1)

commit_message:
Add Extended Maintenance Info

We had questions in the OpenStack Upstream
Institute content asking about the number or
releases that are maintained but did not have
anything in the guide that discussed that.

This patch adds content to support the questions.

Change-Id: I59466ddb45583e0df876cecb0d14455dd168bafd
Story: 2005404
Task: 30413

commit_message:
Move Orchestration methods into Proxy

- Switch cloud.orchestration methods to consume proxy directly.
- Add additional attributes to stack.
- Add "query parameter" resolve_outputs to stack with and extend general 
_find/fetch method to be able to consume additional attributes (normally 
through overloading).

Change-Id: I8c4cb174d8b2d7802e2e94ec907fdebfcdcc9859

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-11 09:28:13.000000000', 'message': "Nova keypair support

Now Trove doesn't support to specify keypair when creating the db
instance, the ssh keys are hardcoded in the guest agent image at the
build time, which makes it very hard to manage.

This patch adds a config option `nova_keypair` that is used as keypair
name when creating db instance. The old way of the image building will
be changed in the subsequent patches.

Change-Id: I41d4e41fc4bc413cdd48b8d761429b0204481932
Story: #2005429
Task: #30462

commit_message:
Nova keypair support

Now Trove doesn't support to specify keypair when creating the db
instance, the ssh key is injected into the guest agent image at the
build time, which makes it very hard to manage.

This patch adds a config option `nova_keypair` that is used as keypair
name when creating db instance. The old way of the image building will
be changed in the subsequent patches.

Change-Id: I41d4e41fc4bc413cdd48b8d761429b0204481932
Story: #2005429
Task: #30462

commit_message:
Calico-etcd: Add pod/container security context

This updates the Calico-etcd chart to include the pod
security context on the pod template

This also adds the container security context to set
readOnlyRootFilesystem to true

Change-Id: I10ff398d7a552d5287d841ca39c77ea097f7e67e

commit_message:
Handle unsetting '[DEFAULT] dhcp_domain'

Fix a long-standing issue whereby setting 'dhcp_domain' to 'None' would
result in a hostname of '${hostname}None' instead of '${hostname}'.

Change-Id: Ic9aa74f5344ba469b61a87de1ebd27e6f49c3318
Closes-Bug: #1824813

messages:
[{'account_id': 27898, 'date': '2019-04-17 10:39:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2019-04-17 11:15:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Should indeed prevent the detection of dangling containers.
For the records, I wanted that validation after tempest in order to ensure nothing has crashed due to service usage. That what raised the issue with neutron dangling sidecars :).'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-04-17 12:03:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

just to clarify, neutron monitors processes via a pidfile. When those processes are no longer needed, a SIGKILL will be sent to them and the pidfile will be deleted.

In OOO, those processes are actually started via a wrapper that it deploys and a new container is started but the monitoring still happens via the pidfile (using host pids). Killing the process through SIGKILL causes what Cedric describes as 'dangling sidecars'."}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2019-04-18 07:09:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2019-04-18 08:06:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2019-04-18 11:37:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-17 10:39:03.000000000', 'message': 'Run validate-services before tempest

Some of the actions done at tempest like create a vm instance restart
some sidecar containers and they appear as failed containers since the
purpose of validate_services is to check them after deploy running
before tempest would be good enough.

Change-Id: I750e4d2ffc139433f7ec2a9a5c4adc6467ad19c9
Closes-Bug: #1824977
'}]
commit_message:
Run validate-services before tempest

Some of the actions done at tempest like create a vm instance restart
some sidecar containers and they appear as failed containers since the
purpose of validate_services is to check them after deploy running
before tempest would be good enough.

Change-Id: I750e4d2ffc139433f7ec2a9a5c4adc6467ad19c9
Closes-Bug: #1824977

commit_message:
Remove "tags" listed in Create port POST api-ref

Attribute 'tags' is not allowed in POST. This patch fixes the issue in
Create port POST api-ref where "tags" is listed. No other resource
api-ref is impacted.

Closes-bug: #1815600
Change-Id: I77232b9eadf628805e162c66f270548a38725078

(2 comments)

sorry in advance for the long responces.

the currennt copleing of numa,cpu topology,memory backing and cpu pinning is the souces of most of the complexity.

numa and cpu topology were intended to apply only to the guest.
cpu pinning and memory backing were ment to apploy only to the host

finnally hw:numa_mempolicy and the pci numa policies were ment to contol if guest memory or pci passthrough devices should be affinitised to the same cores as the guest. 

tldr 
my comment on line 73 basically say the same thing but in more of a rant format.
and my comment on line 84 say yes dpdk does not need hugepages to work. but it does in openstack because reasons see line 84.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-02-13 11:49:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2018-02-13 11:59:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Enable NUMA Features for Libvirt/QEMU Driver

NUMA related features are currently only supported by libvirt/KVM
driver. The aim of this spec is to extend the NUMA support for
libvirt/QEMU driver, which is used for QEMU Tiny Code Generator
backend.

Blueprint: libvirt-qemu-numa-support

Change-Id: I13074846e3442c03ad613c6621133fc355e93b14

"}, {'created': '2018-04-05 07:57:48.000000000', 'message': 'Enable cpu pinning with libvirt/QEMU driver

The QEMU TCG (Tiny Code Generator) backend of QEMU is single-threaded
historically, no matter how many vCPUs have. So there was no way for
libvirt to allow pinning of TCG vCPUs individually.

However, QEMU TCG can support VM wide pinning by pinning that single
thread to specific cores.

This patch enables libvirt/QEMU backend to support vCPU pinning using
the VM wide pinning feature. Since Nova CI gate runs inside VMs and
no nested virt available, this would actually be useful for testing.

bp libvirt-qemu-numa-support

Change-Id: I6ead75a71ebcf7e8790d0b74d71e92d005934b88
'}]
commit_message:
Enable cpu pinning with libvirt/QEMU driver

The QEMU TCG (Tiny Code Generator) backend of QEMU is single-threaded
historically, no matter how many vCPUs have. So there was no way for
libvirt to allow pinning of TCG vCPUs individually.

However, QEMU TCG can support VM wide pinning by pinning that single
thread to specific cores.

This patch enables libvirt/QEMU backend to support vCPU pinning using
the VM wide pinning feature. Since Nova CI gate runs inside VMs and
no nested virt available, this would actually be useful for testing.

bp libvirt-qemu-numa-support

Change-Id: I6ead75a71ebcf7e8790d0b74d71e92d005934b88

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-29 09:11:38.000000000', 'message': "Add NumaTopology support for libvirt/qemu driver

NUMA features weren't supported for libvirt/qemu driver backend,
because qemu TCG doesnt support cpu pinning, and nova uses cpu
pinning implicitly for NUMA related features.

However, qemu backend potentially has capability to support NUMA
topology and hugepages. This patch enables libvirt/qemu driver to
support these features with the following items.

- change NUMATopologyFilter scheduler to include qemu TCG backend
  hypervisors if not cpu pinning features are specified by user
  explicitly.
- change libvirt driver not to set pinning configuration for the
  guest numa cell if the backend is qemu TCG.

bp libvirt-qemu-numa-support

Change-Id: I2fd9ebd5a840a5dd59ae1561cc3f72a03ed0f8f2
"}, {'created': '2018-01-04 01:33:37.000000000', 'message': "Add NumaTopology support for libvirt/qemu driver

pinning implicitly for NUMA related features.

However, qemu backend potentially has capability to support NUMA
topology and hugepages. This patch enables libvirt/qemu driver to
support these features with the following items.

- change has_numa_support() function to include qemu virt type
  to force NUMATopologyFilter to include hosts with qemu backend.
- change _get_guest_numa_config() function not to set indivisual
  cpu pinning configuration but to set VM wide pinning for the
  guest if the backend is qemu.

bp libvirt-qemu-numa-support

commit_message:
Add NumaTopology support for libvirt/qemu driver

NUMA features weren't supported for libvirt/QEMU driver backend,
because QEMU TCG doesnt support individual vCPU pinning, and
nova sets vCPU pinning individually and implicitly if NUMA related
features are specified.

However, QEMU backend potentially has capability to support NUMA
topology and hugepages. This patch enables libvirt/QEMU driver to
support these two features.

This patch changes _get_guest_numa_config() function not to set
individual vCPU pinning configuration but to let vCPUs float
on the CPU cores given by vcpu_pin_set if the backend is QEMU.

bp libvirt-qemu-numa-support

Change-Id: I2fd9ebd5a840a5dd59ae1561cc3f72a03ed0f8f2

subject: Check pinning support in NUMATopologyFilter

[{'created': '2018-01-04 01:33:37.000000000', 'message': 'disable cpu pinning with libvirt/qemu driver

Since NUMA Topology feature has been now supported for libvirt/qemu
driver, NUMATopologyFilter included those hypervisors with the driver.
However, we should exclude those hypervisors when pinning features are
explicitly specified by users.

This patch performs the exclusion by checking if the hypervisor type
in host_state.supported_instances is QEMU in NUMATopologyFilter when
CPU allocation policy is set to dedicated.

bp libvirt-qemu-numa-support

Change-Id: I618e17f979ffab20cb9de026ba6eea11785fbd33

commit_message:
Check pinning support in NUMATopologyFilter

Since the vCPU pinning feature is supported only for KVM backend,
we should exclude hypervisors other than KVM when vCPU pinning
features are explicitly specified by users.

This patch performs the exclusion by checking the hypervisor type
in host_state.supported_instances in NUMATopologyFilter when CPU
allocation policy is set to dedicated.

bp libvirt-qemu-numa-support

Change-Id: I618e17f979ffab20cb9de026ba6eea11785fbd33

commit_message:
Fix typo for self.list

Mistake was introduced in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554950
Added an abstract method list to the base ResourceManager that
raises a notImplementedError if called (instead of using
abc.abstractmethod that would force the implementation of a list
method that might not be required for all resources)

Closes-Bug: #1820045

Change-Id: I0c69e1beeb452a95cc5988a462f733806afbfafc
(cherry picked from commit 0cd6b282920214d2995d1203aa0ad7d33c825b10)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-02 18:15:43.000000000', 'message': 'l2 pop: check for more than 1 first active port on a node

With high concurrency more than 1 port may be activated on an
OVS agent at the same time (like VM port + a DVR port),
so the patch mitigates the condition by checking for 1 or 2
first active ports.

Given that the condition also contains "or self.agent_restarted(context)"
which makes it True first 180 sec (by default) after agent restart,
I believe the downside of changing 1 to 2 should be negligible.

Please see bug for more details on the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1789846
Change-Id: Ieab0186cbe05185d47bbf5a31141563cf923f66f
(cherry picked from commit b32db30874a7729c4e9209cfc18e106a7e9fc697)
(cherry picked from commit 1ba5e6964b5eadd660f2f333e774ce174c4e6f06)
'}]
commit_message:
l2 pop: check for more than 1 first active port on a node

With high concurrency more than 1 port may be activated on an
OVS agent at the same time (like VM port + a DVR port),
so the patch mitigates the condition by checking for 1 or 2
first active ports.

Given that the condition also contains "or self.agent_restarted(context)"
which makes it True first 180 sec (by default) after agent restart,
I believe the downside of changing 1 to 2 should be negligible.

Please see bug for more details on the issue.

Closes-Bug: #1789846
Change-Id: Ieab0186cbe05185d47bbf5a31141563cf923f66f
(cherry picked from commit b32db30874a7729c4e9209cfc18e106a7e9fc697)
(cherry picked from commit 1ba5e6964b5eadd660f2f333e774ce174c4e6f06)

Currently we comment tempest_git_repo in os_tempest role, as we
moved to integrated build repo, we need to define tempest_git_repo

commit_message:
Set tempest_git_repo only when tempest installed from source

Currently we comment tempest_git_repo in os_tempest role, as we
moved to integrated build repo, we need to define tempest_git_repo
otherwise it will fail, we can set this value only when tempest is
installed only from source.

Change-Id: Ic1e7851cbac62dabe824a2e538a0a46233f77a2e
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/465160/3/ : SUCCESS in 2h 08m 14s'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-09-04 09:43:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Based on the bug report it seems that you are trying to spawn an instance with a NUMA Topology and huge pages. I do not think it something we can support in TCG.

How is that possible to make working NUMA where all vCPUs are running on a same host thread? The only thing we can control is where that host thread is floating.
For the case of hugepages I think it's could be something we can support but our current implementation of huge pages is based of the NUMA Topology so it needs more work to make it working for TCG.

Basically the fix here should be to reject users who are trying to use any CPU policies or NUMA topology in TGC."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-09-04 15:20:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

sean:
I think here we have 2 options,
1. We take a position that NUMA can't be supported unless cpu pinning is supported. Here, I think we should state this fix explicitly in rel note. (patch set 7)
2. or take a position that this is just a bug that "Despite qemu supports numa feature, we can't create VM with numa feature from nova as nova implicitly uses cpu pinning if numa feature specified." (patch set 3)

I at first took the option of 2, where I think you take a stand, but with sahid's comment I realized that this produces another bug that "vcpus can float across NUMA nodes despite NUMA feature is specified". 
This is why I now take the option 1.

sahid:
For the reason above I added the rel note for this fix.
But to be honest I'm note sure if this is the right way to add the relnote.
Could you review it, please ?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-07 04:14:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Verified-1

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/465160/7/ : SUCCESS in 2h 15m 30s'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2017-09-07 15:24:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

numa has noting to do with cpu pinning.
it has to do with memory layout.
the fact that we conflate the to frequently has alway been a point i objected too.

the numa topology element were never meant to have an influence on confining a guest to a spefic numa node on the host they were intended
to only modle the guest virtual numa topology.

by the way qemu does not support cpu pining of individual cores with the tci backend but it can do it for all vcpus assocaitaed with an instance.
for example this is supported.
<vcpu placement='static' cpuset="1-4,^3,6" current="1">2</vcpu>
https://libvirt.org/formatdomain.html#elementsCPUAllocation

the issue is i believe libvirt still has a bug where if the cpuset is set in vcpu element 
and it was compiled with cputune support it will auto creat the vcpupin element internally.
that in turn breaks it.

so to be clear, qemu support virtual numa topologies and vm wide core pinning with the tci backend.
libvirt may incorrect create vcpupin element when cpuset is specified in vcpu element and that should be tested.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-09-07 20:19:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

What you are saying does not make sense, NUMA is related to the host CPUs which are addressing different space of memory. If you can't pin the thread running vCPUs you can't take advantage of NUMA and so the "distance" between CPU and memory.

What is true is that; Huge Pages, Realtime, CPU Pinning and all of these features do not have real relation with NUMA *but* in the Nova world they do because we are exposing these features on top of our NUMA topology implementation. So if we want to expose them without a libvirt virt-type which fully supports NUMA we have to make more work.

Until we do not have a real matrix of what is supported for which virt-type it seems reasonable to me to make clear that we only support these features (NUMA and related in the Nova world...) for KVM only.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2017-09-20 00:18:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2017-09-20 00:21:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

In PTG, we agreed not to put things into nova that can't be used in production."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-20 01:50:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified-1

here is an example of creating a
cirros vm with 4 cpus 1 socket 1 thread 1 per core,  
1 numa node pinned to host numa node 0
256 mb of hugepage backed memory
with emuplator thread pined to core 4-7
vcpus pinned to 0-3
with qemu tcg backend with no kvm accleration.

http://paste.openstack.org/show/623633/

you may be able to enable realtime also but i have no idea what ellement i need to add for that.

as i said in my original patch the only feature i know is not supported is 1:1 vCPU to pCPU mapping but you can map all core in
the vm to a set of cores and you can map emulator cores to a defferent set of cpus.

since uploading the past i also enable the ocata cloud archive which uses qemu 2.10 and libvirt 2.5 and that also works

sean@cloud-4:~$ qemu-system-x86_64 --version
QEMU emulator version 2.10.0(Debian 1:2.10+dfsg-0ubuntu1~cloud0)
Copyright (c) 2003-2017 Fabrice Bellard and the QEMU Project developers
sean@cloud-4:~$ libvirtd --version
libvirtd (libvirt) 2.5.0

i also checked the pike branch of the cloud archive but it currently uses the same libvirt and qemu versions as occata and that works also.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-10-16 09:20:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

Sean, we have already discussed of all what you are saying. The code provides comments and there is a reno note.

I would be happy to see a contribution from you testing virt_type=xen and so creating a clear matrix of what we are supporting. Having libvirt driver to support more is probably what will all want.'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2017-10-18 01:37:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

some basic xen testing with libvirt directly 
http://paste.openstack.org/show/623903/

im not going to have time to deploy openstack with xen in the near term but cpu pinning at least works with xen

it seams to happily take the hugepage request as well as the emulator pinning and numa afinity elements.

acorrding to https://wiki.xenproject.org/wiki/Tuning_Xen_for_Performance and https://wiki.xenproject.org/wiki/Xen_4.2_Automatic_NUMA_Placement xen will automaticlly numa afine memory if all cpus are pinned to a single numa node.


i dont know how to validate if hugepages are actully used for the guest as with xen the dom0 i create the guest vm from is actully just a privalved vm running on top of the levle1 xen hypervisor so i cannot directly view the host memory

https://wiki.xenproject.org/wiki/Huge_Page_Support
seam to indicate that xen will use hugepages when it can and that a guest can allocate hugepages iteself but it is not clear that the guest will be backed by hugepages.'}, {'account_id': 7730, 'date': '2017-10-19 08:22:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

Sean, thanks for all of that but what you are testing it's libvirt not Nova, to consider supporting xen your you will have to create instances with Nova also it's important to consider the version of libvirt used and the one we are supporting. I we have discussed we could always enable the support of xen when we will have a clear matrix of what is supported."}, {'account_id': 23871, 'date': '2017-10-19 09:15:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2017-10-23 06:02:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

The main purpose of this patch is to make an unpredictable error into a crisp, predictable one.

As we have mentioned, 2 tasks remain;

1. We should test whether other versions than "virt_type=kvm" can support NUMA Topology.
2. We should make more work to support CPU pinning, hugepages, and realtime features where the virt_type don't support NUMA Topology. (This is because these features are now implemented on NUMA Topology feature in the Nova world.)

To clear things up, I'm going to make new reports for the 2 tasks respectively on the launchpad so that we can continue discussion. The test and discussion whether Xen can support NUMA Topology should be continued related to the first report. The discussion of hugepages with qemu TCG related to the second report.

How's that sound, sean and all?'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2017-11-02 03:03:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review+1

Ok if you have opened bug for testing support for these features in xen and the tcg backend so we can renable them in the future after we know exactly which do and don't work with nova the i guess we can merge this. I just don't want this one edge case. Supported versions of libvit are certainly capable of configuring thes features for non kvm backends but the current nova code path may produce errors."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2017-11-30 18:16:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

(3 comments)

Sean, I'm confused by your review comment..."}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2017-12-07 11:01:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2017-12-07 12:56:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2017-12-07 13:36:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

OK, well, I guess the patch is more restrictive than Sean originally envisioned, but that's OK I suppose. In the future, a less restrictive look at backend-to-feature-availability can be done, but for now this is not terrible.

The only problem I have with this patch, and all patches that touch NUMA/CPU pinning/Huge pages, is that until the Intel CI is back up and running, there's effectively zero testing of NUMA/CPU pinning/Huge page support. I feel very uncomfortable approving anything that changes anything related to NUMA because of this lack of testing.

I'd like Matt to weigh in on this.

-jay"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-12-07 16:48:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

When virt_type is set to qemu, nova uses qemu with TCG backend.
Currently cpu affinity is unsupported by qemu with TCG,
which means that numa topology can't be supported either.

This patch change explicitly raises NUMATopologyUnsupported error
when numa feature is used where virt_type=qemu.

As cpu pinning and hugepages both rely on NUMA topology,
they will also be disabled by this change.

commit_message:
disable numa feature when virt_type is not kvm

Currently we only support NUMA Topology for KVM.

This patch change explicitly raises NUMATopologyUnsupported error
when numa feature is used where virt_type is not set to kvm.

As cpu pinning and hugepages both rely on NUMA topology,
they will also be disabled by this change.

Closes-Bug: #1691178
Co-Authored-By: Tetsuro Nakamura
Change-Id: I000bbb64cacbf2298179e2b9888a1808d514fbec

commit_message:
Select block-storage as service type

block-storage is the official service type for cinder, according to the
service-types-authority starting from OpenStack Stein release [1].

It is unversioned endpoint which replaces old 'volume', 'volumev2' and
'volumev3'.

Also, this patch changes mapping at rally_openstack.const.ServiceTypes,
so all known Cinder service types matche the name of service without
version. Specifiying specific service API version to use was never done
by using these different versioned constants. Mostly this mapping is
done for displaying service catalog via `rally deployment show` and
`rally env info`.

Another thing here is reverting a part of change [2]. It was a wrong
attempt to handle the case of several endpoints of Cinder.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/510939/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/637947/

Change-Id: Ice18db86267e43421a14660f0e66891be0406fad
Signed-off-by: Cdric Ollivier <ollivier.cedric@gmail.com>

[{'created': '2019-04-17 10:37:23.000000000', 'message': '[fedora_atomic] Support auto healing for k8s

Using Node Problem Detector, Draino and AutoScaler to support
auto healing for K8s cluster, user can use a new label
"auto_healing_enabled' to turn on/off it.

Meanwhile, a new label "auto_scaling_enabled" is also introduced
to enable the capability to let the k8s cluster auto scale based
its workload.

Task: 28923
Story: 2004782

(cherry picked from commit 75fab6ff37d5f91c10c883d0e67ac17234250f72)

Conflicts:
	magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/write-heat-params-master.yaml

commit_message:
[fedora_atomic] Support auto healing for k8s

Using Node Problem Detector, Draino and AutoScaler to support
auto healing for K8s cluster, user can use a new label
"auto_healing_enabled' to turn on/off it.

Meanwhile, a new label "auto_scaling_enabled" is also introduced
to enable the capability to let the k8s cluster auto scale based
its workload.

Task: 28923
Story: 2004782

(cherry picked from commit 75fab6ff37d5f91c10c883d0e67ac17234250f72)

Conflicts:
	magnum/drivers/common/templates/kubernetes/fragments/write-heat-params-master.yaml
	magnum/drivers/heat/k8s_fedora_template_def.py
	magnum/drivers/k8s_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/kubecluster.yaml
	magnum/drivers/k8s_fedora_atomic_v1/templates/kubemaster.yaml

Change-Id: I25af2a72a7a960205929374d2300bd83d4d20960

commit_message:
Added snapshot delete event

Previously snapshot delete process wasn't sended to gnocchi,
as snapshot.delete event wasn't descriped in gnocchi_resources.yml
This has been fixed, and snapshot delete now fills resource
ended_at field in gnocchi.

Change-Id: I47a25c50287fbac16f0e5915f166cfb5709d6bad
(cherry picked from commit 611f86b9bc3ad6ebc7940509212587b9f69be9d5)

commit_message:
DNM: add debug logging for bug 1807723

The root cause of the bug seems to be that we're not
properly detaching a volume during a multiattach swap
volume multinode test. This adds logging in the API
to try and confirm that is the issue in the specific
test that is failing.

Change-Id: I39a3638b10bd7c1766bc708275f118d56acb1f66
Related-Bug: #1807723

commit_message:
Modify the value of instance's root_gb when flavor's root_gb is 0

If flavor's root_gb is 0 and root_disk is not a volume,
make instance's root_gb size according to the maximum value of
virtual size, min size and size of the image.

Change-Id: I1ef88b598eb08afbc1bc0558797071475bb1b163
Close-Bug: #1414947

[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2017-11-27 18:36:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2017-11-27 18:37:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2017-11-27 19:57:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-9666 : SUCCESS in 1h 19m 25s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2017-11-28 03:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/523187/2/ : FAILURE in 6h 11m 29s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-11-29 21:07:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 2033, 'date': '2017-11-30 08:11:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

When running a placement service per child cell, api_database in the cells needs to be configured to the local nova_api DBs.
This patch deletes the build_request from the top nova_api.
Just created the bug to link it: https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1735353'}, {'account_id': 2033, 'date': '2017-11-30 08:13:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This patch works great for me.
Matt mention the request_specs. Is there something else that I should be aware?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-12-01 15:11:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Matt mention the request_specs. Is there something else that I should be aware?

I was just asking if we can safely assume this code has the [api_database] configured in all cases such that we can try and query the nova_api.build_requests table. I'm not sure if that's standard in all cellsv1 deployments."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2017-12-04 18:23:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This assumes that nova-cells in the api cell is configured with the same api database that nova-api in the api cell is configured with. That should be a totally reasonable assumption for both cases.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2017-12-04 20:40:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2017-12-04 21:49:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-9832 : FAILURE in 1h 08m 40s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2017-12-05 02:28:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/523187/3/ : SUCCESS in 2h 44m 30s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-12-06 16:05:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

This triggers the update at the top during the build:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/conductor/manager.py#L573

Which because of this patch deletes the build request, which makes us get BuildRequestNotFound here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/conductor/manager.py#L604

And then we destroy the instance mapping and return before casting to compute to actually build the instance, which is why it never goes ACTIVE and we timeout.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-12-06 16:06:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2019-04-18 10:54:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I think this is safe to abandon now'}]

commit_message:
DNM: test resize reschedule up-calls

This is a test for bug 1781300 in a multi-node devstack
environment. It will trigger a reschedule during
resize if retries are enabled (they are by default),
we're on the first attempted host and there are alternate
hosts (which there should be in a 2-node job).

Change-Id: I60179dd8e114b43e482aa03e0939a89278bed128

commit_message:
Role apache-logs-conf: fix redhat matching

Ansible complains:

  The task includes an option with an undefined variable. The error
  was: 'dict object' has no attribute 'RedHat'

which is just a mismatch on the "Redhat" string

Change-Id: I447038256561740c224c68388fa5b6a068cc8fed

commit_message:
Add hack to fix ply installation on opensuse

The python3-ply package is indirectly a dependency of dhcp-client, which
is not exactly an optional package. Pip >=10 refuses to install ply from
global-requirements with this distro package is installed, so our only
option is to remove it manually.

Change-Id: I377fdd4a581eb4b6275584d92cafc0b783fe3b84

commit_message:
Fix ubuntu binary deploys

1. The Keystone WSGI scripts don't have a python3- prefix, although they
   are using python 3.

2. The Placement WSGI script doesn't have a python3- prefix, although it
   is using python 3.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/651327
Change-Id: I805df8f85634edea8322495ca73897d44967cfe6
Closes-Bug: #1823989

'}, {'created': '2019-03-14 13:10:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix typo for self.list

Mistake was introduced in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554950
Added an abstract method list to the base ResourceManager that
raises a notImplementedError if called (instead of using
abc.abstractmethod that would force the implementation of a list
method that might not be required for all resources)

Closes-Bug: #1820045

Change-Id: I0c69e1beeb452a95cc5988a462f733806afbfafc
'}]
commit_message:
Fix typo for self.list

Mistake was introduced in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554950
Added an abstract method list to the base ResourceManager that
raises a notImplementedError if called (instead of using
abc.abstractmethod that would force the implementation of a list
method that might not be required for all resources)

Closes-Bug: #1820045

Change-Id: I0c69e1beeb452a95cc5988a462f733806afbfafc

subject: Fix release-note parsing of deliverable files
messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-04-16 16:09:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2019-04-17 01:35:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-04-18 08:59:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-16 16:09:05.000000000', 'message': 'Fix release-note parsing of deliverable files

The list-changes job would fail to parse deliverable files with the
error "WARNING: Unable to parse $repo $series deliverable file" due to
the repo name being passed in with the leading openstack/ namespace.

This is common code used by list-changes and release-notes. In
list-changes we have the actual name of the deliverable file, so just
use that if it is available.

Also makes sure that cases were we expect just the repo name without
namespace only get what is expected.

Change-Id: Ib7526fc66d05530c2c2c722284c1d64a5242e419
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix release-note parsing of deliverable files

The list-changes job would fail to parse deliverable files with the
error "WARNING: Unable to parse $repo $series deliverable file" due to
the repo name being passed in with the leading openstack/ namespace.

This is common code used by list-changes and release-notes. In
list-changes we have the actual name of the deliverable file, so just
use that if it is available.

Also makes sure that cases were we expect just the repo name without
namespace only get what is expected.

Change-Id: Ib7526fc66d05530c2c2c722284c1d64a5242e419
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Added snapshot delete event

Previously snapshot delete process wasn't sended to gnocchi,
as snapshot.delete event wasn't descriped in gnocchi_resources.yml
This has been fixed, and snapshot delete now fills resource
ended_at field in gnocchi.

Change-Id: I47a25c50287fbac16f0e5915f166cfb5709d6bad
(cherry picked from commit 611f86b9bc3ad6ebc7940509212587b9f69be9d5)

Add endpoint_type attribute defaulting to internalURL

This is in preparation of dropping the admin endpoint, we need this
attribute in place first so we can reference it in other cookbooks.

interface, it will move the ip attributes of the physical interface,

commit_message:
Update interface-ip-details to include device routes

When ml2 linuxbridge agent builds a bridge from a physical
interface, it will move the ip attributes of the physical interface,
or its vlan interface if network type is vlan, to the bridge. The same
set of ip attributes are moved back from bridge when the bridge is torn
down.

Today, however, the set of attributes only include the ip address and
the gateway information. Routes other than the default route are lost.

This commit added routes in the set of attributes to be moved. Default
gateway becomes a subset of the routes and is therefore retained by this
change.

Closes-Bug: #1703510

Change-Id: I3736a820f980659850562641aa432c1fd0af328c
Signed-off-by: Aihua Li <aihuaedwardli@yahoo.com>

[{'created': '2018-02-23 06:53:24.000000000', 'message': 'Adjust processing of centralized fip for dvr

[1]Move processing of centralized fip nat rules for dvr from
fip configuration processing.
[2]Initialize "snat_iptables_manager" earlier because it will
be used in [1].
[3]When add centralized fip for dvr+ha, "add_centralized_floatingip"
of superclass is not needed to be invoked, because fip is configured
by keepalived instance and nat rules are processed in [1].

Change-Id: I815d329616258414c9df5831e0f0862bb0cd0cfd
'}]
commit_message:
Adjust processing of centralized fip for dvr

[1]Move processing of centralized fip nat rules for dvr from
fip configuration processing.
[2]Initialize "snat_iptables_manager" earlier because it will
be used in [1].
[3]When add centralized fip for dvr+ha, "add_centralized_floatingip"
of superclass is not needed to be invoked, because fip is configured
by keepalived instance and nat rules are processed in [1].

Change-Id: I815d329616258414c9df5831e0f0862bb0cd0cfd

commit_message:
debian-minimal buster support

Due to the referenced bug, many versions of debootstrap can't bring up
a buster environment.  Unfortunately, these include versions we use to
do this on Xenial/Bionic nodes.

Also, there isn't backports or security updates, so elide these for
now.

I did get a working build (I haven't gone so far as a full boot+glean)
with this, at least.

Change-Id: If2420e92cb728ab6e91b0d70547da4483679b391
Paritial-Bug: #1822927

commit_message:
Also use selinuxenabled to check selinux status

Currently, the cleanup script is using the existence of the folder
/sys/fs/selinux to check if SELinux is enabled. This, however, is
misleading in case disk-image-builder is used inside a Docker
container on a selinux-enabled host. In this case, the folder exists
in the container but SELinux is disabled.

This patch addresses the problem by checking, in addition to the
check already in place, the output of the command selinuxenabled.

Change-Id: I83e58f2467e60df9f0f00f7b7a58d0e2ce357a9a
Closes-Bug: #1820077

commit_message:
Add --failing option to run only failed testcases

stestr has an option [1] for the failed tests. Add the option for
fast testing iteration.

[1] https://stestr.readthedocs.io/en/latest/MANUAL.html#running-previously-failed-tests

Change-Id: I401fb8b46757692c8f765d5d43a9d82a2b38cefc
Closes-Bug: #1808297
