commit_message:
Handle any network name in ServiceNetMap

In commit, I737d5656b113f7e2238fe7bb555cc2d4cb13877c, support was added
to have the services fall back to the ctlplane network if the default
service network wasn't enabled.

The commit only worked for the hardcoded default network names though
(ItnernalApi, Storage, etc). Given that any network names can be used,
and that our spine/leaf examples show using non-default network names
(IternalApi0, Storage0, etc), the code needs to work for any network
name.

This commit updates the jinja2 logic to work for any network name. It
also handles service_net_map_replace in the jinja2 logic instead of
Heat, so that services can be correctly defaulted when the default
networks don't exist at all.

Change-Id: Icd8d49c0cf8c8ac43348813c502861fb0aa7091f
implements: blueprint split-controlplane-templates
Closes-Bug: #1824025

[{'created': '2019-03-25 14:48:49.000000000', 'message': "Add CinderEtcdLocalConnect parameter

The parameter, when set to true, will configure cinder-volume to connect
to Etcd through the node's own local IP on the Etcd network, instead of
a VIP on the network.

This is useful when deploying cinder-volume in an A/A configuration at
an edge site with the HCI roles. As Etcd and cinder-volume are both
running on the same node (typically 3 nodes configured the same), then
each node can just connect directly to Etcd without having to go through
a VIP. Additionally, we have no VIP management at the edge sites
presently.

Change-Id: I8a8825ecff9fc99b5de7390075470356397d85a2

commit_message:
Add CinderEtcdLocalConnect parameter

The parameter, when set to true, will configure cinder-volume to connect
to Etcd through the node's own local IP on the Etcd network, instead of
a VIP on the network.

This is useful when deploying cinder-volume in an A/A configuration at
an edge site with the HCI roles. As Etcd and cinder-volume are both
running on the same node (typically 3 nodes configured the same), then
each node can just connect directly to Etcd without having to go through
a VIP. Additionally, we have no VIP management at the edge sites
presently.

Change-Id: I8a8825ecff9fc99b5de7390075470356397d85a2
implements: blueprint split-controlplane-templates

commit_message:
Add Etcd to DistributedCompute roles

The Etcd service is needed for A/A management of the CinderVolume
service on these roles so it should be added to the roles by default.

Change-Id: I9d3d17fec857014f399b8339ce7c68f844d230a9
implements: blueprint split-controlplane-templates

commit_message:
Add networking-ovn-tempest-slow job to check queue

It will run all tempest tests marked as "slow", so e.g. most of
the tests from tempest.scenario.test_network_v6 module.

For now it is added as non-voting job. If it will be working well
we can switch it to be voting and gating.

Change-Id: Idfeec1fa4375c346b23ed7b53f352755ea555c5d
Close-Bug: #1770151

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-18 14:42:48.000000000', 'message': 'Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I102d10b2fadc218ae0030b6ea44a37f8a9cba0aa
'}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I102d10b2fadc218ae0030b6ea44a37f8a9cba0aa

commit_message:
Do not try to create temporary URLs with zero lifetime

A new option is introduced for that, which defaults to the deploy timeout
if it is set and to 1800 seconds if it is not.

Change-Id: I10e02919e40d25bd4411f2b6f98f9317d1cfb187
Story: #1653112
Task: #9707

commit_message:
Automatically resume after openstack upgrade

After an openstack upgrade automatically resume. Without this a gate in
config_changed stops configuration of keystone catalog entries. That
gate is still useful for the series-upgrade process.

Related-Bug: #1824545

Change-Id: I1c1c7f214b580fd39f023a562ab78aaf3da9a79e

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-18 20:36:43.000000000', 'message': 'Define a hook to configure Octavia o-hm0 iface

The OVN DHCP responder replies to the dhclient on o-hm0 from Octavia
with unsolicited DHCP options. DHCP client requests specific options
which do not include default gateway, yet DHCP server replies with
Default-Gateway and 169.254.169.254 route. While the route might not be
much critical on Devstack deployments, the addition of a L3 gateway is:
it conflicts with the existing one and thus starts routing traffic via
an undesired device.

This patch disables the gateway on the lb-mgmt-subnet. Be warned that
doing so will prevent amphorae traffic to the outside of the network.
Octavia tempest tests do not depend on that so it is safe to not enable
gateway.

Reference: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1689368

Change-Id: I2c410d11297ef7e55eaead55067f890cfc5537bc

commit_message:
Define a hook to configure Octavia o-hm0 iface

The OVN DHCP responder replies to the dhclient on o-hm0 from Octavia
with unsolicited DHCP options. DHCP client requests specific options
which do not include default gateway, yet DHCP server replies with
Default-Gateway and 169.254.169.254 route. While the route might not be
much critical on Devstack deployments, the addition of a L3 gateway is:
it conflicts with the existing one and thus starts routing traffic via
an undesired device.

This patch disables the gateway on the lb-mgmt-subnet. Be warned that
doing so will prevent amphorae traffic to the outside of the network.
Octavia tempest tests do not depend on that so it is safe to not enable
gateway.

Reference: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1689368

Change-Id: I2c410d11297ef7e55eaead55067f890cfc5537bc

(3 comments)

How will networking be facilitated, or expected?  It seems like Cleaning would not be something that would be required or even needed with this sort of hardware, nor would a deployment network be needed, so the noop driver may be what is required, or a variation on the flat network interface driver.

Additionally, It seems like the conductor could start and discover the hardware on the node, as opposed to an operator adding the hardware directly which is an interesting prospect.  Since there is no persistent storage, that kind of actually seems viable, at least for initial node enrollment/creation.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-04-17 15:34:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Spec seems abandoned. Marking as such.'}]

commit_message:
WIP: Add VCA hardware type to Ironic

This spec describes the new hardware type for Ironic, which can
be used in baremetal clouds containing Intel Visual Compute
Acceleration (VCA) cards.

Change-Id: Idb10e5a5703c16413422e0eeab69114a1eee7a4c
Partial-Bug: #1621458

commit_message:
Support transfer pagination

This patch adds support for transfer pagination.

Co-Authored-By: Yikun Jiang <yikunkero@gmail.com>

Closes-bug: #1814195

Change-Id: Idb04f783b2287b2b45d626131648b0005a232fbe

commit_message:
Avoid lb creation conflict by first searching for it

It changes the steps perform at the ensure function to first search for
the loadbalancer and then, if not found, trigger its creation

Change-Id: I5b84ff7e4c31a46070ec6f6d4d14cfaa499978b4

[{'created': '2018-12-13 18:08:12.000000000', 'message': 'Update messaging intermediaries for amqp1 tests

This patch messaging intermediaries used for the amqp1 driver
test. The combination of the apache qpid-dispatch-router (qdrouterd)
with an attached apache artemis broker is used in place of the qpidd
broker. The qdrouterd will directly message oslo.messaging rpc
communications and will link route oslo.messaging notify
communications to the artemis broker (e.g. for persistence).

This patch:
* updates the dependencies
* updates the test environment setup
* uses the pifpaf drivers to create servers

Change-Id: I9fb56450346fca84bc1573fa5e9b6fe81c14e33a

commit_message:
Update messaging intermediaries for amqp1 tests

This patch messaging intermediaries used for the amqp1 driver
test. The combination of the apache qpid-dispatch-router (qdrouterd)
with an attached apache artemis broker is used in place of the qpidd
broker. The qdrouterd will directly message oslo.messaging rpc
communications and will link route oslo.messaging notify
communications to the artemis broker (e.g. for persistence).

This patch:
* updates the dependencies
* updates the test environment setup
* uses the pifpaf drivers to create servers

Change-Id: I9fb56450346fca84bc1573fa5e9b6fe81c14e33a

commit_message:
Enable bionic/stein and disco/stein functional tests

Pin charm ``ntp`` at bionic as it has not been updated to support
``cosmic`` and ``disco`` yet.

Move disco to dev_bundles pending LP: #1824318

Change-Id: I8335572961c5d2f97a3059ae5eb5295b2e8e9d66

commit_message:
[fedora atomic] Allow traffic between k8s workers

When using calico as network driver, the traffic between k8s
worker nodes need to be allowed otherwise services maybe not
accessible sometimes because connection can't be established.
This issue only impacts calico.

Task: 30525
Story: 2005294

Change-Id: Ia71283a1abc75a7fb806f2601ac09a685dc5a4bc

subject: Rename Chef OpenStack project and update it
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 308, 'name': 'Thierry Carrez', 'email': 'thierry@openstack.org', 'username': 'ttx'}, {'_account_id': 1004, 'name': 'Mohammed Naser', 'email': 'mnaser@vexxhost.com', 'username': 'mnaser'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 10607, 'name': 'Alexandra Settle', 'email': 'a.settle@outlook.com', 'username': 'asettle'}, {'_account_id': 11904, 'name': 'Sean McGinnis', 'email': 'sean.mcginnis@gmail.com', 'username': 'SeanM'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-03-28 09:40:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-03-28 09:41:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure whether this is allowed, but I think it would make sense to change the project name to make it inline with the main repository and the irc channel.

The main issue I see is having a space in the name is complicating some things, so if this change is unacceptable in its current form, maybe moving to "OpenStackChef", adapting "OpenStackAnsible" as a role model, or maybe just dropping the space and having "ChefOpenStack" would be possible alternatives.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-03-28 10:23:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> I'm not sure whether this is allowed, but I think it would make
 > sense to change the project name to make it inline with the main
 > repository and the irc channel.
 > 
 > The main issue I see is having a space in the name is complicating
 > some things, so if this change is unacceptable in its current form,
 > maybe moving to "OpenStackChef", adapting "OpenStackAnsible" as a
 > role model, or maybe just dropping the space and having
 > "ChefOpenStack" would be possible alternatives.

Completely agree with the change, for what it's worth. It makes sense to have it all aligned.
Otherwise, I don't know how else to do this. An email to the ML with this PR attached so others can definitely see this would be advisable.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-03-28 13:39:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I think this is fine, but let's hold off on merging any changes until we wrap up Stein just to make sure there aren't any unintended side effects that will cause a last minute fire drill while we're supposed to be stabilizing things."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-03-28 15:05:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2019-03-28 15:07:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Oh, the ordering is case-insensitive, I was trying to put "^o" after "^O", hopefully that works better now. 

I'm fine with waiting after Stein is released, I'll also create a mail to the list in the meantime.'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-03-29 09:42:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Oh, the ordering is case-insensitive, I was trying to put "^o"
 > after "^O", hopefully that works better now.
 > 
 > I'm fine with waiting after Stein is released, I'll also create a
 > mail to the list in the meantime.

Thanks Jens!'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-04-01 14:24:23.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from update-chef to project-update'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2019-04-04 10:08:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1

+1 for added consistency here'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2019-04-08 12:35:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2019-04-09 14:32:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1

I like consistency!'}, {'account_id': 10607, 'date': '2019-04-10 14:45:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-04-14 16:56:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2019-04-17 14:44:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Catch socket.timeout for connectivity error when streaming

While fetching remote templates, if there is network issue while
reading data chunks socket.timeout is raised.

Change-Id: I4ebb495706ea3c505a92254b1f03e326b0fa34b6
Story: #2004686
Task: 28694
(cherry picked from commit e3d54b74fad45d786f4c80fff8af5245ecdd1713)

[{'created': '2019-04-16 12:17:41.000000000', 'message': 'Enable support for novajoin tempest plugin

For testing FreeIPA in OpenStack, novajoin is used for the same.
In order the same setup in different distribution, we need to
enable support of novajoin tempest plugin.

By setting tempest_service_available_novajoin to true will install
the novajoin tempest plugin.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Enable support for novajoin tempest plugin

For testing FreeIPA in OpenStack, novajoin is used for the same.
In order the same setup in different distribution, we need to
enable support of novajoin tempest plugin.

By setting tempest_service_available_novajoin to true will install
the novajoin tempest plugin.

Change-Id: Ieeb35ebed80a5ebccb4dd9204e89e26129498b83
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar <chkumar@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-16 14:55:24.000000000', 'message': 'Implement Prometheus fetcher

A Prometheus scope fetcher has been added in order to dynamically discover
scopes from a Prometheus service using a user defined metric and a scope
attribute.
It can also filter out the response from Prometheus using metadata filters
to have a more fine-grained control over scope discovery.
It features HTTP basic auth capabilities and HTTPS configuration options
similar to Prometheus collector.

commit_message:
Implement Prometheus fetcher

A Prometheus scope fetcher has been added in order to dynamically discover
scopes from a Prometheus service using a user defined metric and a scope
attribute.
It can also filter out the response from Prometheus using metadata filters
to have a more fine-grained control over scope discovery.
It features HTTP basic auth capabilities and HTTPS configuration options
similar to Prometheus collector.

Change-Id: If3c2da8d7949e0aec08f3699547faf34af4ddee4
Story: 2005427
Task: 30458

commit_message:
Switch to {{ undercloud_user }} for rsync

{{ ansible_working_dir }} doesn't seem to expand to a valid path when
the playbook is ran by zuul.
Switching to {{ undercloud_user }} seems to work.

Change-Id: I0d89e379eae257289dc2fe560ccdaa14bdea9047

commit_message:
Add OS::TripleO::NovaAZConfig

This service is mapped to OS::Heat::None by default, but when enabled,
it uses external deploy tasks to create a new aggregate and zone in
Nova. All Compute nodes in the stack will be added to the zone by
default.

The zone name is the stack name by default, but can be overridden with
parameter values.

Change-Id: I0afb2265949f1222a86b350734e62da673e83aa9
Depends-On:I064f872e20537642880d5482cb9e0c2a801715ef
implements: blueprint split-controlplane-templates

commit_message:
Add release note issue around rabbitmq-server upgrade

This patchset adds to the Known Issues section about the rare issue of a
rabbitmq unit not coming back up after a charm upgrade.

Change-Id: I3c9a6c45337e4a40367ad3b96884de5e531b34d7
Related-Bug: #1824842

python-requests api misused (invalid kw).
raw images could not be streamed correctly down to the host

Story: #2005357

testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html

commit_message:
Support reapply with supplied introspection data

This patch adds support to provide unprocessed introspection data
to reapply a node. The provided introspection data will be save to
current introspection storage backend.

Change-Id: I969ae9c32f53f89c006a64a006388ddea9542aa5
Story: 1564863
Task: 11344

messages:
[{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-20 15:53:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-20 18:50:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Has passed in-development ironic CI tests: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568829/32. Ubuntu binary failed because the ironic-neutron-agent container is not available as an ubuntu package.'}, {'account_id': 19316, 'date': '2018-11-21 10:50:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28614, 'date': '2018-11-21 13:25:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22165, 'date': '2018-11-21 13:45:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-11-21 14:05:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 27420, 'date': '2019-04-17 12:27:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-20 15:53:36.000000000', 'message': 'Load configfs kernel module for iscsid

The configfs kernel module is not mounted by default in Ubuntu 16.04,
leading to the iscsid container failing to start because it bind mounts
/sys/kernel/config. The issue does not apply to Ubuntu 18.04, or other
distros (AFAIK), which load configfs by default.

This change loads the configfs module when the iscsid container is in
use.

Change-Id: I5b521ddca24b919658d2664ede2d878507d6d106
Closes-Bug: #1631072
'}]
commit_message:
Load configfs kernel module for iscsid

The configfs kernel module is not mounted by default in Ubuntu 16.04,
leading to the iscsid container failing to start because it bind mounts
/sys/kernel/config. The issue does not apply to Ubuntu 18.04, or other
distros (AFAIK), which load configfs by default.

This change loads the configfs module when the iscsid container is in
use.

Change-Id: I5b521ddca24b919658d2664ede2d878507d6d106
Closes-Bug: #1631072

[{'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2019-02-22 14:08:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2019-03-04 09:18:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-03-04 10:51:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hello Lajos:

First of all, I understand this is a WIP patch.

1) Can I know how are you going to spawn this fake placement process? Let me point you to [1]. This is a context manager, without authentication, to be used in testing. Does it match your needs?

2) I don't know if these kind of changes, in neutron-lib, are "allowed" for testing. If needed, you can mock the PlacementAPIClient class in fullstack tests in order to make these changes.

As I said, I know this is a WIP. Maybe is not possible (2).

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/placement/direct.py'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2019-03-04 15:58:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Rodolfo:
I considered using placement, but Slaweq opinion was not to "pollute" fullstack environment with external service dependencies. This is good for us as well as the only need is to something blindly respond back to neutron's placement report service plugin as the real placement.
The goal of the test is to test weird situation when placement service temporarily unavailable, for that something lightweight is better.

I hope I can upload the test soon as well, I hope you can check together with that as well and I am ready for any suggestion.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2019-03-07 15:30:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2019-03-11 17:24:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8313, 'date': '2019-04-10 08:42:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2019-04-10 08:51:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Understood and I agree.

Notes:
- For sure, boden will ask you to add a release note hehehe.
- Maybe (just maybe) I'll add a one line description saying this class is used in testing.

Code looks good.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2019-04-10 13:17:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add noauth option for placement client

To make possible the fullstack testing of bandwidth reporting towards
placement and syncing of resources, we have to start a small process, a
fake placement that can answer back placement REST API requests.
For this we have to add a noauth client to bypass keystone in case of
fullstack testing.

Change-Id: I199157e47f05f3b21eed15a1eb39b31a009030dd
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/642527
Partial-Bug: #1578989
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/502306 (nova spec)
See-Also: https://review.openstack.org/508149 (neutron spec)

commit_message:
Add rabbitmq policy configuration task

This patch adds support of rabbitmq policies configuration for mq_setup
and uses oslomsg_rpc_policies and oslomsg_notify_policies variables for
that. These variables are defined in group vars and provide HA mode.

It also adds ability to provide extra policies during include by
specifying _oslomsg_notify_policies and/or _oslomsg_rpc_policies
variables.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/652186/
Change-Id: Id60b7ac62ff16af938577615ab001dd144f92c26

commit_message:
Add global HA policy for rabbitmq

This patch adds 2 new variables into group_vars: oslomsg_notify_policies
and oslomsg_rpc_policies. These variables contain default rabbitmq
policies, which will be applied for every vhost.
As for now they contain only 1 policy, which enables HA mode[0].

[0] - https://www.rabbitmq.com/ha.html

Change-Id: I6857b2f8ccab169a2317b1de4cc106404534e3e4

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-16 14:59:27.000000000', 'message': "Ensure that the manager.py re-connects if it gets a 500 error

This patch works around a bug during upgrades where (it is believed)
that the manager.py script can hold a 'stale' connection to the apache2
hosted keystone, which then returns a 500 HTTP error when next used.

Also, an additional stop_manager_instance() is used after a service
restart to try to ensure that the last ditch approach (above) is not
needed.

Change-Id: Id9c9b967742467f30270f52c2a8b6634f6480324
Related-Bug: #1823743

commit_message:
Ensure that the manager.py re-connects if it gets a 500 error

This patch works around a bug during upgrades where (it is believed)
that the manager.py script can hold a 'stale' connection to the apache2
hosted keystone, which then returns a 500 HTTP error when next used.

Change-Id: Id9c9b967742467f30270f52c2a8b6634f6480324
Related-Bug: #1823743

subject: Use endpoint_override in version negotiation
messages: [{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2019-04-17 04:27:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2019-04-17 04:30:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-04-17 07:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-04-17 07:38:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 2d3807a5216a564eb5341a84232c434da2866964'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-17 04:27:36.000000000', 'message': "Use endpoint_override in version negotiation

Change [1] introduced the usage of endpoint_filter when deciding which
endpoint to use during version negotiation. This requires properly
setting interface/region/service_type in order to properly pick the
endpoint. But, sometimes (for example in Kolla-ansible), the endpoint
url is explicitly defined. In the event of the endpoint being explicitly
defined, it should take priority here.

It should be noted that even though SessionClient extends from
keystoneauth1's adapter.LegacyJsonAdapter, the `request` function within
_make_simple_request is being called on the nested Session object, not
the Adapter itself. If it was called on the Adapter this problem
wouldn't exist, as the `endpoint_override` (or `endpoint`) kwarg passed
in to the constructor of the SessionClient would already take
precedence.

Additionally: Adds a release note to the older branch as this is a
fix that needs to be released and is worthy of change visibility
in release notes.

[1]: I42b66daea1f4397273a3f4eb1638abafb3bb28ce

Change-Id: I69dc2c88648ba1d09a9ad3ab3435662e8d1ea6ff
Related-Bug: #1818295
(cherry picked from commit 8071d5de57c728ce09d25d04c8c9fe48cd7db42e)
"}]
commit_message:
Use endpoint_override in version negotiation

Change [1] introduced the usage of endpoint_filter when deciding which
endpoint to use during version negotiation. This requires properly
setting interface/region/service_type in order to properly pick the
endpoint. But, sometimes (for example in Kolla-ansible), the endpoint
url is explicitly defined. In the event of the endpoint being explicitly
defined, it should take priority here.

It should be noted that even though SessionClient extends from
keystoneauth1's adapter.LegacyJsonAdapter, the `request` function within
_make_simple_request is being called on the nested Session object, not
the Adapter itself. If it was called on the Adapter this problem
wouldn't exist, as the `endpoint_override` (or `endpoint`) kwarg passed
in to the constructor of the SessionClient would already take
precedence.

Additionally: Adds a release note to the older branch as this is a
fix that needs to be released and is worthy of change visibility
in release notes.

[1]: I42b66daea1f4397273a3f4eb1638abafb3bb28ce

Change-Id: I69dc2c88648ba1d09a9ad3ab3435662e8d1ea6ff
Related-Bug: #1818295
(cherry picked from commit 8071d5de57c728ce09d25d04c8c9fe48cd7db42e)

commit_message:
Allow admin update cluster/template in any project

Now Magnum supports list, get, delete user's cluster/template by admin,
but not allowed for updating. We're seeing this could be a very useful
feature for us, since sometimes we need to help our customer to update
their templates or clusters on behalf.

Task: 30251
Story: 2005323

Change-Id: I3ab1d4583b5eb3d1c377e46fd73347c2477c3e08

'}, {'created': '2019-04-17 03:21:35.000000000', 'message': 'Make ironicclient always respect endpoint_override

In the current implementation the endpoint_override
is not respected during version negotiations. This
means that a critical components of any api call
that does endpoint_override is going to be done
against the wrong region.

This can cause the wrong version to be negotiated,
or even worse make the call fail because the other
region was uncreachable.

Change-Id: Id1912ff5115e0679188bb02d6252e15ab1d906f5

commit_message:
Make ironicclient always respect endpoint_override

In the current implementation the endpoint_override
is not respected during version negotiations. This
means that a critical components of any api call
that does endpoint_override is going to be done
against the wrong region.

This can cause the wrong version to be negotiated,
or even worse make the call fail because the other
region was uncreachable.

Change-Id: Id1912ff5115e0679188bb02d6252e15ab1d906f5

commit_message:
Set HA failover bridges veth pair devices UP

The test bridge veth pair devices is not up which cause the
VRRP advertisement packet can not pass to each HA port. Then
multiple master router is up. This patch just sets the veth
pair devices up.

Closes-Bug: #1819160
Change-Id: I0e0d0311d73bce83d3c7341e7a0167917818b1ff

commit_message:
Disable validations on f28 standalone

Validations were enabled with a featureset_override.
This review keeps the featureset_override setting
( so it can be easily replaced back to true) but
disabled validations while the related bug is
under investigation.

Change-Id: Ia84350c466230ae2894e7501b74c71a98a63f06f
Related-Bug: #1824977

'}, {'created': '2018-05-07 12:02:10.000000000', 'message': "Fix failed to import test module

The wrap @testtools.skipUnless cause the base class
SnapshotAccessReadBase to be the <type 'function'>,
However, it should be <type 'type'>, this cause the
functional test unbale to import the test module.

Closes-bug: #1769633
Change-Id: I98a296d009e64d6afab02a53bd1af878f78c4321
"}]
commit_message:
Fix failed to import test module

The wrap @testtools.skipUnless cause the base class
SnapshotAccessReadBase to be the <type 'function'>,
However, it should be <type 'type'>, this cause the
functional test unbale to import the test module.

Closes-bug: #1769633
Change-Id: I98a296d009e64d6afab02a53bd1af878f78c4321

According to the discussion today in the Neutron L3 meeting, what we need to solve the problem with the DVR tests is:
- Set up the veth pairs between both HA bridges [2].
- Give to each router independent resources [3].
- Apply this patch to check the router status.

I'll rebase this patch in top of [3], which is rebased to [2].

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/neutron_l3/2019/neutron_l3.2019-03-27-14.01.log.html#l-69

commit_message:
Check master/backup router status in DVR functional tests

When two routers are created at the same time, we can't assume the
status of each one. Instead of this, the status of each router is
first checked and then compared to the other router status.

Change-Id: If20a3a414986ea29fbfd50616761c14e5b249b2c
Closes-Bug: #1819160

[wip] Streamline locking in the Quobyte Driver

Removes some superfluous locks and switches locking
to use cinder.coordination locks.

Closes-Bug: #1707159

What do you think about enabling node problem detector in a separate patch and script? We could take that asap.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-03-07 09:08:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

Yep, sure. We can do that. So to split this one into 2 patches, one for NPD+Draino, one for CA, do you want the autohealing_enabled label in the first NPD+Draino patch?'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-03-07 10:33:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

NDP can be always on and in its own patch.

draino is closer to autohealing'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-03-07 10:33:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

s/NDP/NPD/'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-03-13 01:16:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-03-19 03:53:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-03-19 08:44:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 16.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-03-21 02:22:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2019-03-22 15:32:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

Thanks for the review, Diogo.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-03-25 21:14:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-03-27 02:23:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2019-03-29 15:09:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(3 comments)

Upstream updated the name from os-autoscaler to cluster-autoscaler
https://github.com/kubernetes/autoscaler/blob/master/cluster-autoscaler/cloudprovider/magnum/examples/cluster-autoscaler-deployment-master.yaml
Maybe we should update aswell?'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-04-01 01:35:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(3 comments)

Thanks for the review, @Diogo. Did you manage to make this patch work for you? Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2019-04-01 09:26:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-04-02 10:38:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-04-02 16:36:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-04-02 22:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-04-03 00:47:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 20.'}, {'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2019-04-05 13:49:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

COMMAND> openstack coe cluster create scale --cluster-template kube --node-count 1 --keypair default
 ERROR: The Parameter (max_node_count) was not provided. 

 The max_node_count should not be needed if i want a static cluster

 

HEALING> Shouldn't the label; draino-enable=true be added to all minions 
by default? It seems that the cluster should heal at launch but we actually need
to set label manually

  kubectl label node health-n2iabcyz7wav-minion-0  draino-enabled=true



HEALING PROBLEMS>
1. The one refered before where draino will not run on master. Effectively ending up by evicting it self if the cluster is 1 master 1 node
2. There is a problem with the cluster-autoscaler that uses existing nodes as a template for the created nodes. In the situation where draino uncordons the only node existent the cluster-autoscaler will think the new pod will get the Taint SchedulingDisabled and it will never launch a new one. This will make the cluster state permanently stale (unless a update is made on openstack manually)
I think this situation is important to include in the Known Issues if ClusterHealing is intended to be launched in this version


After this fixes all shall be fine :D"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-04-07 07:37:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 20:

(1 comment)

1. The max_node_count should not be needed if i want a static cluster

Will be fixed in next PS.

2. Need manually set label by kubectl label node health-n2iabcyz7wav-minion-0  draino-enabled=true

Will be fixed in next PS.

3. The one referred before where draino will not run on master. Effectively ending up by evicting itself if the cluster is 1 master 1 node

Now the draino pod will run on master nodes. Will be fixed in next PS.

4. There is a problem with the cluster-autoscaler that uses existing nodes as a template for the created nodes. In the situation where draino uncordons the only node existent the cluster-autoscaler will think the new pod will get the Taint SchedulingDisabled and it will never launch a new one. This will make the cluster state permanently stale (unless a update is made on openstack manually)
I think this situation is important to include in the Known Issues if ClusterHealing is intended to be launched in this version

As you said, it's a limitation of auto scaler, I'm going to propose a following patch to document how the autoscaling and auto-healing work to avoid confusing end users.


5. NPD change /config/docker-monitor-filelog.json 2>&1 | tee /var/log/node-problem-detector.log

I think it's doable. And I have tested it works. Will be fixed in next PS.

6. Draino conditions

Replied in line."}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-04-07 08:30:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 21.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-04-07 22:13:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 22.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-04-07 23:31:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-04-08 00:22:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

@Diogo, I have addressed all your comments. Please revisit. Thanks.

I will propose another patch to add more documents to explain how the auto scaling and auto healing work and the limitations. Cheers.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-04-09 02:18:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24: Patch Set 23 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-04-09 04:15:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

-1 for "region used as ng" and incomplete cloud-config (ca-file)'}, {'account_id': 30262, 'date': '2019-04-12 14:55:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

> -1 for "region used as ng" and incomplete cloud-config (ca-file)

What should ca-file to be set to in order to use the default certificates installed in the container?

Alternatively it could just mount the entire /etc/kubernetes directory from the host into the CA pod and that gives both the kube_openstack_config or cloud-config file, so there is no need to make it a secret, and the correct ca-bundle.crt if it's a devstack environment.

The [LoadBalancer] and [BlockStorage] sections are not used by the autoscaler either, so having those defined in the secret isn't useful.'}, {'account_id': 30262, 'date': '2019-04-12 15:10:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-04-13 07:42:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 26:

@Spyros, are the NG name and the ca-file in cloud-config the last concerns from you about the overall patch/design?

1. As for NG name, I'm happy to change it to 'default-worker' since it doesn't matter based on the current implementation of the magnum driver in CA.

2. As for the ca-file in cloud-config, my question is why the current magnum driver in CA could work without it?

@Thomas, as Spyros asked if we have to add the ca-file, could we create the ca-file as a Secret and then mount it to /config/ca-file ? just like the cloud-config"}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-04-15 00:02:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 27.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-04-15 03:17:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 28.'}, {'account_id': 6484, 'date': '2019-04-15 04:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28:

11:12 < strigazi> pushed openstackmagnum/cluster-autoscaler:v1.0
11:12 < flwang1> strigazi: cool
11:12 < strigazi> not it has the fix https://github.com/kubernetes/autoscaler/pull/1873'}, {'account_id': 20498, 'date': '2019-04-17 09:13:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29:

s/not it has the fix https://github.com/kubernetes/autoscaler/pull/1873/NOW it has the fix 
                  https://github.com/kubernetes/autoscaler/pull/1873/'}, {'account_id': 30262, 'date': '2019-04-17 09:46:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29:

I have made a PR to include the CA magnum cloud provider in the 1.14 branch, ready for a 1.14.1 release - https://github.com/kubernetes/autoscaler/pull/1911.

There will be an official release container image for 1.14.1, but I recommend building from the branch ourselves with the "magnum" build tag, as this produces an image of about ~50mb instead of ~100mb (which is with all the other cloud providers included).

The cluster-autoscaler Makefile in make-image tags the image with ${REGISTRY}/cluster-autoscaler${PROVIDER}:${TAG}, so for us it would be cluster-autoscaler-magnum:1.14.1. Or we can just do the build manually and keep the name as "cluster-autoscaler", but I do think the version number should be kept in sync.'}]

commit_message:
[fedora_atomic] Support auto healing for k8s

Using Node Problem Detector, Draino and AutoScaler to support
auto healing for K8s cluster, user can use a new label
"auto_healing_enabled' to turn on/off it.

Meanwhile, a new label "auto_scaling_enabled" is also introduced
to enable the capability to let the k8s cluster auto scale based
its workload.

Task: 28923
Story: 2004782

Change-Id: I25af2a72a7a960205929374d2300bd83d4d20960

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: I2c8a0a49f9d575cb3cb9c7eeb9bce4686c9fe223

commit_message:
Fix InfluxDB storage's "_point_to_dataframe_entry" method

This fixes the "_point_to_dataframe_entry" method by checking if the
"metadata" and "groupby" attributes of points returned by the influxdb
client are not None.

Change-Id: Ic7e482fad3ad05026fa14412acb577fe7a02045c

It should not be up to the driver to handle the error. The error should
reach the manager. Moreover, handling the error in the driver and
returning nothing caused the manager to consider the step done and go to
the next one instead of interrupting the cleaning workflow

Change-Id: I3825838b5507bc735d983466aa3cac0edd4dfaca
Story: #2005357
Task: #30315
(cherry picked from commit df5261bb349dd56ac88876e14779d244bdc0beb3)
'}]
commit_message:
Ansible module: fix clean error handling

It should not be up to the driver to handle the error. The error should
reach the manager. Moreover, handling the error in the driver and
returning nothing caused the manager to consider the step done and go to
the next one instead of interrupting the cleaning workflow

Change-Id: I3825838b5507bc735d983466aa3cac0edd4dfaca
Story: #2005357
Task: #30315
(cherry picked from commit df5261bb349dd56ac88876e14779d244bdc0beb3)

commit_message:
Ansible module: fix partition_configdrive.sh file

Images with GPT partition tables could not be deployed correctly
The if condition could never be met due to an invalid syntax, leading to
partitioning failure

Change-Id: I11202b115f9b80e8c853dca36cc66ab0eb8f7dea
Story: #2005357
Task: #30317
(cherry picked from commit 84741e94095e2a7c07ff880a17983e373c28eab0)

commit_message:
Update permission checks to include top level directory checks

By expanding the scope of the checks, we can maintain a higher
level of security by ensuring that newly created files created
in project configuration folders are restricted in the same
way as those listed, without hoping that projects update these
checks when they create these files.

For example, making /etc/keystone/keystone.conf have ownership
settings of root:keystone with permissions of 640 is practically
the same as giving /etc/keystone settings of root:keystone with
permissions of 750 as the same user restrictions apply.

Change-Id: I53d395e0d17bdfbdb08b71431b0af29506b94aa9

[{'account_id': 30133, 'date': '2019-04-05 10:33:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-04-05 10:33:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 30133, 'date': '2019-04-05 10:39:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30133, 'date': '2019-04-05 11:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 30133, 'date': '2019-04-07 20:39:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 30133, 'date': '2019-04-07 20:54:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 30133, 'date': '2019-04-09 11:30:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 20733, 'date': '2019-04-10 05:44:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Allow NovaRbdPoolName to be role specific

Currently, TripleO does not support to create Compute roles
using different Ceph pools as Nova Ephemeral backends.
An admin should be allowed to have groups of compute nodes
using different Ceph's Ephemeral pools improving
availability, reliability and performance.

The change is straight forward adding the
role_specific tag to the parameter NovaRbdPoolName.

Closes-Bug: 1821039

Change-Id: I7c1ac7c0d3a987c8c9c1e070ea773875aa684d88

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: Id530578688faf2e97165b40abe18b863126cf89f

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-16 11:19:32.000000000', 'message': 'Enable file logging for podman neutron sidecars

In order to get a more complete container logging, we now enable
the file logging for the podman containers.
This will output container stdout/stderr in a file located in the
new /var/log/containers/stdout location.

This follows the other efforts already made with paunch[1] and
docker-puppet.py (now named container-puppet.py)[2]

Notes:
- podman supports only "json-file", allowing to push files in the
  location we want via the "path" log option
- docker doesn't have the "path" log option and push its log in
  /var/lib/docker/containers/ID/ID-json.log - unusable since it's
  destroyed upon container removal.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/635437
[2] https://review.openstack.org/635438

Change-Id: Ibaa8bca52ea2f68afa1effc989b04d2e6213813a

commit_message:
Enable file logging for podman neutron sidecars

In order to get a more complete container logging, we now enable
the file logging for the podman containers.
This will output container stdout/stderr in a file located in the
new /var/log/containers/stdouts location.

This follows the other efforts already made with paunch[1] and
docker-puppet.py (now named container-puppet.py)[2]

Notes:
- podman supports only "json-file", allowing to push files in the
  location we want via the "path" log option
- docker doesn't have the "path" log option and push its log in
  /var/lib/docker/containers/ID/ID-json.log - unusable since it's
  destroyed upon container removal.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/635437
[2] https://review.openstack.org/635438

Change-Id: Ibaa8bca52ea2f68afa1effc989b04d2e6213813a

messages:
[{'account_id': 29833, 'date': '2019-01-22 10:15:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2019-01-22 10:15:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2019-01-30 05:28:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hello Yannic Ahrens,

I noticed you had submitted your first patch to OpenStack! Congratulations! I just wanted to reach out and follow up with you on the comments on your patch to see if you need any help. We want to help you get your patch merged and help you be successful in our community! 

Please let us know if you have any questions about your patch, the review process, or the community itself. 

I have added a Magnum dev, Spyros Trigazis, to your patch who can help you along your OpenStack journey!

Matthew Oliver (mattoliverau) and the rest of the First Contact SIG'}, {'account_id': 29833, 'date': '2019-01-31 10:02:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

"openstack coe cluster config <c>" fails with a TypeError with Python 3.

commit_message:
Use oslo for base64 encoding

"openstack coe cluster config <c>" fails with a TypeError with Python 3.
Stdlib's base64.bs64encode expects a byte array whereas the certificate data is
passed as a string. This commit replaces the call to stdlib's base64
with the oslo equivalent.

Closes-Bug #1812816
Change-Id: Ifccb2dd051d520166c5162bea1d18619c008dfd7

commit_message:
Correct ovn-dbs health check

We can't really check the socket presence in containers:
- ovn doesn't really listen to them
- playing with lsof and ss doesn't help, since there are some
  issues with inodes and overlays

The new healthcheck ensures the service is properly running, and
will fail if ovn-northd has an issue.

Please note: the current STDERR has some output, this is due to
some packaging issue being worked on right now.

Change-Id: I645e18cf198a948479083df94b5d373ed92f2aae
Closes-Bug: #1823882

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-04-12 15:51:09.000000000', 'message': "Improve aggregate version check error messages with min_version

The aggregate set/list commands require at least version 1.1 but
if you don't specify any version we default to 1.0 and you get this
unhelpful message:

  Operation or argument is not supported with version 1.0

This change adds a simple min_version kwarg to the version compare
method such that if we fail the version check and the kwarg is passed
we use it to improve the message so the user doesn't have to read
the help of the command to figure out what they did wrong, e.g.:

  Operation or argument is not supported with version 1.0; \
  requires at least version 1.1

This only handles the aggregate set/list commands and could be used
elsewhere but this is just a start.

Change-Id: I28a859918ab78c8aa47e54928cb14339c7c75498
Story: #2005448
Task: #30498
"}, {'created': '2019-04-17 05:30:58.000000000', 'message': "Improve aggregate version check error messages with min_version

The aggregate set/list commands require at least version 1.1 but
if you don't specify any version we default to 1.0 and you get this
unhelpful message:

  Operation or argument is not supported with version 1.0

This change adds a simple min_version kwarg to the version compare
method such that if we fail the version check and the kwarg is passed
we use it to improve the message so the user doesn't have to read
the help of the command to figure out what they did wrong, e.g.:

  Operation or argument is not supported with version 1.0; \
  requires at least version 1.1

This only handles the aggregate set/list commands and could be used
elsewhere but this is just a start.

Change-Id: I28a859918ab78c8aa47e54928cb14339c7c75498
Story: #2005448
Task: #30498
"}]
commit_message:
Improve aggregate version check error messages with min_version

The aggregate set/list commands require at least version 1.1 but
if you don't specify any version we default to 1.0 and you get this
unhelpful message:

  Operation or argument is not supported with version 1.0

This change adds a simple min_version kwarg to the version compare
method such that if we fail the version check and the kwarg is passed
we use it to improve the message so the user doesn't have to read
the help of the command to figure out what they did wrong, e.g.:

  Operation or argument is not supported with version 1.0; \
  requires at least version 1.1

This only handles the aggregate set/list commands and could be used
elsewhere but this is just a start.

Change-Id: I28a859918ab78c8aa47e54928cb14339c7c75498
Story: #2005448
Task: #30498

commit_message:
Dropping the py35 testing

All the integration testing has been moved to
Bionic now[1] and py3.5 is not tested runtime for
Train or stable/stein[2].

As per below ML thread, we are good to drop the py35
testing now:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/005097.html

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-April/004647.html
[2]
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/stein.html
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/runtimes/train.html

Change-Id: Iadf3c4d3aa284a6701f0e9bfd4f1f1e9c8e5cb51

The releases repo added a validation for PyPI meta files.
The command line is "python3 setup.py check --restructuredtext --strict".
Violation is found in README.rst in networking-bagpipe and
it blocks the release process.

All references in README.rst need to work only with README file.

Change-Id: I647ed8a15cbe6ac60272d21db18602bf2d1eea41
(cherry picked from commit 2d2f61c8364cf3056a898965014d422f5198dcac)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix README setup.py check error

The releases repo added a validation for PyPI meta files.
The command line is "python3 setup.py check --restructuredtext --strict".
Violation is found in README.rst in networking-bagpipe and
it blocks the release process.

All references in README.rst need to work only with README file.

Change-Id: I647ed8a15cbe6ac60272d21db18602bf2d1eea41
(cherry picked from commit 2d2f61c8364cf3056a898965014d422f5198dcac)

Change-Id: Ib5c451a8c8cad7b6c9a009369c1c039563023368
"}, {'created': '2019-04-15 07:34:12.000000000', 'message': "Don't use default mutable parameter

Using default mutable parameter is bad.
Default parameters are evaluated only once
if you mutate it you will get unexpected results.
Since we don't mutate here the default paramter, make
sure it is unmutable.

Change-Id: Ib5c451a8c8cad7b6c9a009369c1c039563023368
"}]
commit_message:
Don't use default mutable parameter

Using default mutable parameter is bad.
Default parameters are evaluated only once
if you mutate it you will get unexpected results.
Since we don't mutate here the default paramter, make
sure it is unmutable.

Change-Id: Ib5c451a8c8cad7b6c9a009369c1c039563023368

This is a procedural review to transition pike into extended maintenance by

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code

commit_message:
[requirements] create pike-em tag against final releases

This is a procedural review to transition pike into extended maintenance by
creating the pike-em tag

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

Change-Id: I3789791453ddc1e2bafab6614ac128790d855a61

commit_message:
[requirements] final releases for pike

This is a procedural review to tag a final release for each deliverables ; and

It's possible that the release isn't needed (for example if there are no code
changes sine the previous release, sadly that's non-trivial to detect en masse.

If you are the PTL or release liaison for this team please +1 this review
if it is ready or -1 and take over the review to correct mistakes.

Change-Id: Ic903a44556ff98bb6ca8cbba4c0767ebe5cc3549
